loans.name: God Gift Group

texts.en:
Mary S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Gift.  She is 34 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 7 and 29 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For eight years, she has been selling fufu (a locally produced food made from cassava) in Congo Town Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of fufu. 

She describes herself as a respectful woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of fufu

loans.name: Kyamugarura Co-Operative Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Charles would like a loan to buy more maize for reselling at a profit so as to earn an income. He rides a motorcycle and buys maize which he resells to earn an income.

Charles is married with four children and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house, buying a car and educating his children.

Charles is a member of a group called Kyamugarura Co-operative where each member guarantees the others for access to credit.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Nakawa neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.

Hadjah has a business of selling raw food (cassava, sweet potatoes and yams).  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market on a retail basis.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of yams, cassava and sweet potatoes. She also generates additional income through her rental rooms.  The main business challenge for Hadjah is seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.   Hadjah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of yams, potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Prosperity Group

texts.en:
Teta S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Prosperity.  She is 32 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 1 and 17 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For two years, she has been selling dried fish in West Point Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

She describes herself as an honest and trustworthy woman whose dream is to improve her business, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 50 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Jerry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerry from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 53 years old and is married with three adult children. Bernardita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernardita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Comité San Antonio, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 17 de junio de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas, quien se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de artículos artesanales, contactó y con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y de esta manera con la capacitación de una asesorada  formaron sus con mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8° ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. 
La señora Gloria es una de las integrantes y se encuentra muy satisfecha con su grupo y con los créditos que reciben a culminar exitosamente cada ciclo. 
Así ella trabaja en la venta de mercerías y cada crédito que recibe lo invierte en su negocio a fin de ampliar y contar con todas las necesidades de los clientes que visitan su local. 
Este crédito lo destinara a la compra de mercadería como artículos de mercería, bazar, regalos, cuadernos, bolígrafos, papeles de todo tipo, carteras y otros.
Agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible este proyecto ya que es muy útil para las mujeres que integran los distintos comités.
texts.en:
This group of women started up the communal bank called "San Antonio" in the city of Itá on Jun 17, 2008. The current director of finance, who has a business making and selling handicrafts, contacted a counselor in a weekly meeting that she held in the area to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras works, and with some training provided by the counselor she got some women to form a group. They are now comfortable working with each other; they are in their 8th loan cycle and work together cooperatively in the program. Gloria is one of the members, and she is very pleased with her group and the loans that they received, and the fact that they are completing each loan cycle successfully. Gloria works selling notions (sewing and craft supplies), and she invests every loan that she receives in her business so that she can expand it and have everything that her customers need when they visit her store. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as notions, consumer goods, gifts, notebooks, pens, all types of paper, handbags and other items. She is grateful to all of the people who make this project possible, since it is very useful for the women who belong to the various groups.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: notions, stationery goods, consumer goods, appliqués, gift arrangements, and decorations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of liquor to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. sells cassava, plantain and bananas at Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy assorted fruits to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit in her business.

Abena has been through senior high school. She is divorced and lives with her child. She is responsible for feeding, educating and clothing her child.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Prayer Warriors Group

texts.en:
John K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Prayer Warriors. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of one and fourteen years. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints.

For sixteen years, John has been selling rice, milk, sardines, powder, soap, body spray, hair grease, etc., in Thinkers’ Village on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, milk, sardines, powder, soap, body spray, hair grease, etc. 

John describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, milk, sardine, powder, soap, body spray, hair grease, etc.

loans.name: Good Guys Group

texts.en:
Lawrence G., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Guys. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are three and seven years of age. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints.

For seven years, Lawrence has been operating a foreign exchange bureau and selling phone cards in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 11,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. He describes himself as a friendly man whose goal is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), maize and okro (okra) at Elmina. She is married to a cleaner and has one child. She is responsible by supporting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Nana has received senior high education.

Nana’s loan will be used to buy more bags of gari to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to plow back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery M. sells pay-as-you-go cell phone cards in Elmina. She sells cell phone cards for the various networks in Ghana – MTN, Zain, Tigo, and Vodafone. She has no educational background. She is divorced with two children and responsibly feeds the family.

Mery’s loan will be used to buy more cards and unit transfers for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more cards and unit transfers to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. cooks red-red (rice and beans) at Elmina for sale. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has two children and is responsible for the wellbeing of her family.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy bags of rice and beans and other ingredients to prepare for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save in order to cook other foods to bring variety into her sales.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans and other ingredients to prepare for sale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard C., 58 years old and married to Dinah Kiptarus, has been been blessed with eight children between the ages of 31 and 14. Richard supports a family of five, in that two of his elder children have their own families.

Richard has been in the farming business, his primary source of income, for the last 20 years, earning an average profit of Kshs 2,000 per month. Richard is borrowing Kshs 15,000 in his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase farm inputs: fertilizers for Kshs 7,000, maize seeds for Kshs 5,000, and labor for Kshs 3,000.

Richard plans to use the profits to expand the business and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to give the best education possible to those of his children still in school and be able to provide some support even to his married children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukore Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
Hard working and honest T. Ireen of the Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukore group, Rukungiri has been running a retail shop from Katerera trading centre in Rukungiri, where she sells general merchandise and basic items for home use. She has been operating this business for over 8 years. 

Ireen started this business with capital she got from her farming business and so far it has earns her 280,000 Ugandan Shillings.  This mother of 5 children confirms that she has had problems in restocking her business as the stock that she has available is not satisfying for the customers demand.

Therefore Ireen is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for her business  with hope of earning more income and be in position to cater for her family needs and improve on her standard of living. She belongs to a group of other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: restocking business

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teresa P. y la Sra. Aurelia Bogarín, quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas decidieron invitar a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18(Díez y Ocho) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
 Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas de todo tipo, tienen almacén, despensa, copetín, tienen huertas y comercializan sus propios productos. Venden artículos de limpieza, mercería, venden carbón, mandioca, bijouterie, etc. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa quien se dedica a la confección de ropas para damas y caballeros. 
Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace varios años y cuenta con buena cantidad de clientas quienes le solicitan las confecciones de acuerdo al modelo que cada uno elija.
Esta actividad es muy sacrificada ya que desgasta mucho la vista  nos comenta la señora  Teresa, pero es la profesión que elegí y es lo que sé hacer y hasta ahora con este trabajo pudo ayudar a su familia.
Ella aparte de los pedidos que recibe también confecciona prendas que ofrece a varias tiendas.
Actualmente desea confeccionar prendas de la temporada entrante y para ello solicita el préstamo para compra de telas  y otros accesorios que ella utiliza.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Teresa P. and Aurelia Bogarín who had approached the office of “Fundación Paraguaya” (Paraguay Foundation) to find out more about the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). The ladies decided to invite their neighborhood friends to become involved in group work in order to get ahead and improve their lifestyles. They are 18 humble, but hardworking women who must earn a daily living. They each run their business independently; businesses such as clothing sales, different types of food sales, general stores, and pantry stores. They also have crops and they sell their products. They sell cleaning products, general merchandise, charcoal, cassava, knickknacks, etc. Teresa, one of the members, and she makes men’s and ladies’ clothing. She’s been doing this for several years and she has a good number of customers who solicit her services, based on their needs. This is very hard work and it causes much eye strain, but Teresa tells us, “This is the profession I chose and this is what I know how to do.” She also says that this is how she is able to help her family. Aside from the orders she receives from her customers, she also makes clothing that she offers to various

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba M. sells secondhand bedspreads and necklaces at Elmina by moving from one area to another. She has been educated up to the senior high level. She is divorced, taking care of three children, and responsibly sees to it that they are in good health.

Araba has been dealing in secondhand goods for eight years. Her loan will be used to buy extra used bedspreads for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy extra used bedspreads to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Virtuosas, se conformó en fecha 29 de octubre del 2008, mediante el deseo de la señoras de conformar un grupo unido para trabajar y de esa manera ayudar a sus familias.
De esta manera cada una tiene su actividad en forma independiente y también realizan algunas actividades para recaudar fondos y así se ayudan mutuamente con la responsabilidad conjunta que tienen. 
La Sra. Petrona A. es una de las integrantes y posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, debido a su buena ubicación posee buena clientela y buena demanda de sus productos, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de las frutas y verduras que posee para comercialización.
Ella desea agrandar el negocio, adquiriendo al por mayor frutas y verduras, abaratando los costos y así obtener más ingresos por su venta, así tambén desea incrementar a travéz de la venta de jugos y ensaladas de frutas, postres. Para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de frutas.
texts.en:
“El Comité de Mujeres Virtuosas” (The Committee of Virtuous Women) was formed on October 29, 2008, by women who wanted to form a group that would allow them to work and in this way help their families. Each member is able to run her own business, while at the same time collect funds to mutually support one another in their collective responsibilities. Ms. Petrona A. is one of the members and has a fruit and vegetable stand. It’s in a good location, she has a good customer base, and demand for her products is high because of the good customer service she provides and because of the quality of fruits and vegetables that she sells. She wants to add to her business by acquiring larger quantities of fruits and vegetables, thereby lowering her costs and increasing her profits. She also wants to start selling juices, fruit salads, and desserts. She is asking for this loan so she can buy more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Prossy has a business as a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Prossy sells her products from home at retail.  Prossy has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics cream relaxers and braids. 

She also generates additional income through farming. The main business challenge(s) for Prossy include rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also educating her children up to university. Prossy lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids,

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las trabajadoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 27de octubre de 2009.
Hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la  Fundación Paraguaya.

La Sra. Verónica se dedica a la cría, engorde y venta de gallinas, posee un buen gallinero, bien apto para la cría de aves de corral, en el posee una respetable cantidad de animales, los cuales estan bien alimentados, por lo que generan buenos ingresos al momento de la venta, por ser muy bien demandados por la clientela.
Actualmente está deseando ampliar el gallinero y por consiguiente la cría de los pollos, por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de pollitos en gran cantidad, así también alimentos balanceados y equipos para la suministración de alimentos y agua.
Con la ampliación estará generando más ingresos, teniendo en cuenta que ya es bastante conocida en la zona y aumento el consumo de la carne de aves, por el precio más accesible.
texts.en:
This group of excellent hard working women is called “Las Trabajadoras” (Working Women), and was formed on October 27, 2009. They are currently in their 4th program cycle and work at different things, but also work together to build up funds. They mutually support one another to reach their group objectives and those they have within “Fundación Paraguaya.” Veronica, one of the members, raises, fattens up, and sells chickens. She has a good chicken coop, well suited for raising corral birds and she has a respectable number of chickens, which are well fed. They generate a good income for her because they are well sought after by her customers. She wants to expand her chicken coop and subsequently wants to increase the number of chickens she raises. To do this, she needs to invest in a large number of chicks, balanced feed, and equipment to supply the birds with feed and water. This expansion will generate a greater income, given that she is well known in the zone, and the consumption of chicken has increased, due to more accessible prices.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de animales (pollitos) para cría y engorde, así como alimentos balanceados.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. sells provisions at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has one child. She is able to take care of herself and child with the income she makes from her sales.

Maame’s loan will be used to buy additional provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop from which to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions to sell

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La señora Maria Nela de 36 años, tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica al negocio de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y  sopas este negocio lo inicio su madre por iniciativa propia desde hace 2 años y que hoy día administra Maria desde las 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, las ventas son regulares por lo que desea invertir más para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella está solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de Arroz,  frijol, aceite y otros productos que necesita en su negocio. Los sueños de ella son mantener un negocio estable por muchos años, desarrollarse dentro del mercado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Nela, 36, has 4 children. She operates a small corner store where she sells basic commodities, sweets, household products, etc. Her mother started the business 2 years ago and Maria manages it from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. Business has been steady and Maria wants to invest in a wider range of the good for her customers. She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy rice, beans, cooking oil and other products that she needs for the business. What she most wants is to hold on to the business and improve it so that she can, in turn, help improve the lives of her family

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Ii Group

texts.es:
El Comité Las Emprendedoras II, es un excelente  comité conformado el 31 de Mayo de 2.010, integrado por 20 mujeres de la Ciudad de Itagua. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Marcelina V.  se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La Sra. Marcelina posee un puesto de venta de comidas, entre comida rápida y almuerzos, así también posee bebidas para la venta, entre gaseosas, refrescos, jugos, etc., está muy bien situada y posee ya una buena clientela fija así como clentes ocasionales.
Teniendo en cuenta la demanda de sus productos gracias a la calidad, salubridad y buen trato, desea incrementar sus ingresos, abaratando los costos mediante la adquisición al por mayor de los productos que más utiliza para la fabricación de los alimentos, así como son la carne, tanto vacuna como de aves y cerdos, verduras, empaquetados como harinas, fideos, etc.; condimentos y ampliar la variedad de bebidas.
De esta forma estaría obteniendo más ganancias y así podrá seguir creciendo en el ramo de la gastronomía.
texts.en:
“El Comité Las Emprendedoras II” (Committe of Entrepreneurial Women II) is a group of 20 excellent women from the city of Itagua. The group was formed on May 31, 2010. This group formed, because Ms. Marcelina V. went to a loan renewal meeting in her neighborhood to learn more about the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) and she got very excited and anxious to work with this program. Now the group is in its second cycle of the program. Marcelina has a food stand where she sells fast food and lunches. She also sells carbonated drinks, soft drinks, juices, etc. It’s in a good location and she has steady and occasional customers. Because of the demand for her products, and thanks to their quality, healthiness, and good customer service, she wants to lower her costs by buying ingredients in quantity, such as beef, poultry, pork, vegetables, flour, noodles, etc. This will help increase her profits. She also wants to expand the variety of drinks that she offers. This way she can increase her income and continue to grow within the food industry.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a fish monger and also sells cloth at Elmina. Adjoa has received junior high education. She is married to a driver and has three children. With the support her husband she is able to properly take care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra fish to smoke for distribution to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy extra fish to smoke

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua N. sells bread, eggs, biscuits and other goods at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. She is responsible by helping her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 34 años, se dedica brindar el servicio vulcanización y venta de combustible. Tiene 2 hijos, ambos menores de edad a su cargo. Nelson inicio desde hace 4 años el brinda un excelente servicio, la mayoría de sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante
Actualmente tiene una clientela que vive cerca de su vivienda.Solicita el préstamo para la compra de combustible y además llantas, herramientas y aumentar su inventario de mercadería.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson, 34, operates a tire-repair and gasoline-sales business. He has 2 young children, both of whom depend on him. Nelson started the business 4 years ago. He provides an excellent service to his customers, who are drawn from the neighborhood, and the majority of whom are repeat customers. Nelson is applying for a loan to buy gasoline and tires for the business, along with tools and other supplies that he will stock for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, no tiene hijos, actualmente está cursando el 2do. Año de licenciatura en enfermería en la Universidad del Norte filial Itá.
 La señorita Gloria trabaja como empleada en la Boutique Johana hace más de 6 años, es encargada general de la boutique, el ingreso que tiene como empleada la ayuda a abonar sus cuotas de la facultad pero manifiesta que le cuesta mucho cubrir el costa de su cuotas más libros, folletos, derechos de examen ya que cuesta mucho dinero, además ayuda a la manutención de su hogar, y debido a eso recurre a la Fundación Paraguaya a solicitar un préstamo con el que pueda cancelar por adelantado sus cuotas de la faculta y derechos de examen.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old, lives at her parents' house, and has no children. She is currently in her second year of Nursing at the Universidad del Norte's Ita campus. Gloria works has been an employee of the Boutique Johana for more than six years, and works as the boutique's manager. The income she earns helps her pay her university tuition, but she says it is very difficult to pay tuition plus books, printouts, and exam fees, since they are quite costly and she also helps pay for her family's household expenses. This is why she came to Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan, so that she can pay her tuition and exam fees ahead of time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana B. F. tiene 43 años de edad, reside en la Aldea Tempiscapa. Desde hace unos años se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo alimenticio y para el quehacer del hogar. Su familia está conformada por su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 13 y 11 años. Su negocio es muy rentable ya que en la Aldea solo hay dos pulperías y una es la de ella. Juana solicita este préstamo para surtir su negocio de más productos (arroz, azuca, frijoles, manteca, churros, galletas, maseca, jabon, azistin, ace, cloro, pan, cafe, etc) para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten de manera que siempre visiten su pulpería y sea su primera opción. Su meta es tener un mercadito y educar a sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades de vida. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por varios ciclos y es muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana B. F., 43, lives in the Honduran town of Tempiscapa. For some years, she has operated a business selling everyday products such as groceries and household supplies. Her family includes her husband and their four children who are 21-, 17-, 13, and 11-years old, respectively. Juana's business is very profitable because there's only one other business like hers in the town. Juana is applying for this loan so that she can stock her business with the products she sells (rice, sugar, beans, butter, churros, cookies, flour, soap, cleaning products, bread, coffee, etc.). She wants her customers to be able to find the products they need so that her shop will be the first one they come to. Juana wants to grow her business so that she, in turn, can provide her children with a good education and the best opportunities available to them. She has been a FAMA customer several times before and is very prompt about repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Harold Luis

texts.es: Harold Luis B., es un tendero muy joven que tiene una tienda desde que, procedente de la ciudad de Montería, zona ganadera de Colombia, llegó al municipio de Soledad cargado de muchos sueños y no encontró un trabajó. Fue   así como aprendió como ayudante de la tienda de un amigo y tomó esa experiencia para luego emprender su propio negocio en esa misma actividad. Su microempresa funciona desde hace 10 años, pero desde hace 1 año lo compró con sus ahorros, este es el segundo crédito que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva porque planea comprar ranchos víveres y refrescos en mayor volumen preparándose desde ya, para las fiestas que vienen a final de año. Con su negocio vinculado a esta organización  ha ampliado los conocimientos de administración con cursos de capacitación, legalizó su negocio y ya tiene registro mercantil mediante el programa de formalización y legalización empresarial. Su principal sueño es llegar a ahorrar para comprar la vivienda donde funciona porque en la actualidad está en condiciones de arrendamiento, así como seguir estudiando porque aspira a ser un contador juramentado y desde ya se prepara asumir con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo un crédito educativo para ese fin.
texts.en:
Harold Luis B. is a young businessman who owns his own store. He is a native of Monteria, an agricultural area of Colombia. He moved to the town of Soledad with high hopes, but he couldn't find a job. He worked as an assistant at a friend's store and used the experience he gained there to start his own business. He has operated the business for 10 years now, but only bought it outright 1 year ago. This is Harold's second Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan, a loan that he will use to buy larger volumes of the meats and cold drinks that his customers will want for year-end parties. Harold has been able to use his connection with the bank to learn new business skills and legalize his business. His greatest hope is to save enough money to buy the building where he operates the business because, for now, he's only renting space. He also wants to continue his accounting studies and he is planning to take out another Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan to pay for it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Tomas Alberto

texts.es: Don Tomás habitante de colonia Los Pintos, conforma una familia de 4 miembros: su esposa y 2 hijos, el mayor estudia tercer año de universidad de la carrera Ing en Zootecnia y la menor que estudia 4to grado de primaria, los que en conjunto colaboran en los quehaceres de la unidad de producción, este señor labora en su finca realizando actividades pecuarias con su pequeño inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso, necesita este financiamiento para utilizarlo  en retencion de ternero, logrando de esta manera mantener el numero de su inventario y que en el transcurso de un año estos animales puedan ser comercializados a un mejor precio para ayudar a la estabilidad de la econonmia familiar, es una persona muy pregresiva y con mucho entusiasmo de superacion, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre de buenas costumbres,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño..
texts.en:
Don Tomás lives in the neighborhood of Los Pintos. His wife and two children make up their family of four. The older child is in their third year of college studying animal husbandry and the younger one is in the 4th grade. The workers in his production unit collaborate on activities. Don Tomás carries out ranching and agricultural activities as his main source of income. He needs this loan to keep his calves to maintain the number of his inventory. In the course of a year, these animals can be marketed at a better price to help the economic stability of his family. He is a very progressive person who enthusiastically desires to succeed. In his community he is viewed as a man of good character. He hopes the requested loan will help him make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retain and raise calves

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mme Z. Mawuena est née en 1980 à Gapé Afomekponawoé. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Analphabète sans aucune instruction, elle s’est adonnée au travail de la terre. Ces cultures principales sont le maïs, du manioc et du haricot. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité agricole. Très dévoué et courageuse, elle a une grande expérience dans son activité et sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son champ et par conséquent augmenter sa productivité et ses revenus agricoles pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mme Z. Mawuena est née en 1980 à Gapé Afomekponawoé. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Analphabète sans aucune instruction, elle s’est adonnée au travail de la terre. Ces cultures principales sont le maïs, du manioc et du haricot. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité agricole. Très dévoué et courageuse, elle a une grande expérience dans son activité et sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son champ et par conséquent augmenter sa productivité et ses revenus agricoles pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: agrandir son champ

loans.name: Favio

texts.es: Favio es habitante de la colonia los Laureles, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos dos mayores que trabajan y ayudan a fortalecer la ecomomia familiar y dos menores que coloboran en los quehaceres del hogar; Favio labora en su pequeña parcela en actividades agricolas, siembra de cultivos de granos basicos y tuberculos, siendo su principal fuente de ingreso,  requiere de este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de pasto en su pequeña parcela y poder tener condiciones para menejar su pequeño inventario ganadero, espera ser beneficiaddo con KIVA, para hacer realidad su sueño y poder vivir  en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Favio lives in the Laureles neighborhood with his family that consists of his wife and 4 children. The two oldest are working and contribute to the family income, and the two youngest help with the household chores. Favio farms a small piece of land where he grows basic grains and tubers. Since this is his principal source of income, he needs financing so that he can plant grass on his small piece of land and have better conditions to handle his small herd of cattle. He hopes to receive a loan with KIVA so that he can realize his dream and to be able to live in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant grass

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: Don Osmar es habitante de laColonia San Miguel, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos manores de edad,  labora en su parcela realizando actividades pecuarias con su pequeño inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso, necesita este financiamiento para invertirlo en establecimiento de pasto mejorado y asi poder brindar mejor alimentacion a su a su hato bovino, la mayor intencion de este cliente es tener una finca con buenas condiciones de pasto para mejorar la produccion de leche, logrando mejorar su ingreso economico en el nucleo familiar, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombbre progresivo, trabajador y responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Don Osmar is a resident of the neighborhood of San Miguel. His family is made up of his wife and 3 young children. He carries out ranching activities with his small inventory of livestock, as well as working in agriculture as his main sources of income. Osmar needs this loan to invest in improved grass installation to be able to provide better food to his herd of cattle. His ideal dream is to have a farm with good pasture conditions to improve milk production, thereby increasing income for his nuclear family. In his community he is considered progressive, hardworking, and responsible. Osmar hopes the requested loan will make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve pasture conditions by installing grass

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Ariel tiene 46 años es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo, el se dedica a la venta y compra  de ganado hace mas de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio por un hermano que le enseño este medio de vida a la cual él se hace cargo, lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida su familia, Carlos  solicita su préstamo para la compra de vacas, chivos y toros. Es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Carlos Ariel is 46 years old, married, and has one seven year old child in his care. He has had a business selling and purchasing livestock for more than 12 years, which he started because his brother taught him this livelihood, of which he has taken responsibility. This will allow him to improve his income, consequently improving his family's quality of life. Carlos asks for his loan to buy cows, goats and bulls. He is a very hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi B. sells second-hand clothing at Elmina. Esi has no educational background. She lives together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Nueva Esperanza está integrado por 4 socias (Doris, Rosany, Yina y Dunia), las cuales residen en la comunidad de Tierra Blanca y realizan diferentes actividades económicas. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. Doris Emerita F., tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y tiene 10 hijos. Inicio hace 11 años a vender calzado, cosméticos y plásticos en su domicilio y cuando las ventas son muy pocas horna pan y rosquillas para obtener ganancias extras. Doris solicita el préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de zapatos sobre todo aquellos que están a la moda, cosméticos de diferentes marcas para que las mujeres siempre estén bellas y así ella podrá llamar la atención de más personas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Doris espera mejorar tanto la calidad de vida de ella como la de su esposo ya que son personas mayores de edad, su anhelo es que Dios les siga dando salud para seguir disfrutando de su familia y prosperidad en su negocio. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por 8 ciclos y ha mostrado un comportamiento de pago excepcional.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) Communal Bank is comprised of four members; Doris, Rosana, Yina, and Dunia. They live in the Tierra Blanca community, and they have different economic activities. Doris Emerita F. is the coordinator of the group. She is 60 years old, married, and has ten children. Eleven years ago she started selling footwear, cosmetics, and plastics in her home. When there are very few sales she bakes bread and “rosquillas” (a ring-shaped cookie) to get extra income. Doris is requesting the loan to buy a greater quantity of shoes, especially those that are in style. She will also buy different brands of cosmetics so that women can always look beautiful. That way she will be able to get more people’s attention. With the support from this loan Doris hopes to improve the quality of her life and that of her husband. They are now elderly. Her wish is that God continues to give them their health in order to continue enjoying their family. She also wishes for prosperity in her business. She has been a FAMA client for eight cycles. She has demonstrated excellent payment behavior.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, shoes, and plastics

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vecinas está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Liliam S. Romero quien vende nacatamales, gaseosa y refrescos desde 1972. Ella tiene la meta de un día poder trabajar con su propio dinero. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa V. quien tiene una pulpería y Lila Margarita Rodríguez quien vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The “Las Vecinas” (The Neighbors) group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Liliam S. Romero is one of them. She has been selling nacatamales, soft drinks, and snacks since 1972. Her goal is to one day be able to work with her own money. Rosa V. is another member of the group, and she has a grocery store. The third member of the group is Maragarita Rodríquez, and she sells nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, onions, sweet peppers, rice, potatoes, soft drinks, and snacks

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Handicapé physique, Mr A. Yao est né en 1973 à Gapé Tsikalé dans le Zio. Après ses études primaires, il se lance dans de petites activités génératrices de revenus. Finalement il s’est consacré à la fabrication et à la vente de paniers. Il fabrique lui-même les paniers et les revend aux bonnes femmes commerçantes. Malheureusement ses moyens financiers dérisoires ne lui permettent pas de produire suffisamment pour répondre à la demande des femmes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de disposer des moyens afin de fournir régulièrement ses clientes.
texts.en: Handicapé physique, Mr A. Yao est né en 1973 à Gapé Tsikalé dans le Zio. Après ses études primaires, il se lance dans de petites activités génératrices de revenus. Finalement il s’est consacré à la fabrication et à la vente de paniers. Il fabrique lui-même les paniers et les revend aux bonnes femmes commerçantes. Malheureusement ses moyens financiers dérisoires ne lui permettent pas de produire suffisamment pour répondre à la demande des femmes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de disposer des moyens afin de fournir régulièrement ses clientes.

loans.use: fabrication et  vente de paniers

loans.name: Yajaira Abigail

texts.es: Yajaira habitante de comarca mokoron, su familia esta conformado por su esposo y un hijo menor el cual estudia educacion primaria, su principal actividad es su pequeño negocio venta de ropa, es una mujer muy progresiva y con deseo de superacion, su esposo colabora en los quehaceres de su unidad de produccion y  tambien con el manejo de su inventario ganadero,  necesita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de ropa para surtir el inventario de su negocio y de esta menera mejorar el nivel de sus ingresos economicos en la familia, en su comunidad la consideran como un persona de buenas costumbres,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Yhajaira lives in the Mokoron region. Her family is comprised of her husband and a minor child who goes to elementary school. Her main activity is her small business of selling clothes. She is a very progressive woman with the desire to excel. Her husband assists with production unit tasks and with managing their inventory of livestock. She needs this loan to buy clothes to stock the inventory in her business. This will improve the family’s level of income. In her community she is considered to be a person of good moral values. She hopes to receive a Kiva loan to be able to make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make purchases for her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has three children. She has received senior high education. Ama sells body creams at Elmina. Her husband is a repairman. Ama uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more body creams and lotions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business. Ama plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more body creams and lotions for sale

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery M. is single. She has junior high level of education. Mery is a seamstress and sells panties and underwear at Elmina. Mery uses her income to take care of herself. Mery will use the loan to purchase more panties and underwear for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mery plans to save to revive her sewing business.

loans.use: purchase more panties and underwear for sale

loans.name: Hector Bonifacio

texts.es: Don Hector habitante de Nueva Guinea, desde hace cuatro años labora como conductor de camion en la hacienda la Ponderosa, siendo esa actividad su principal fuente de ingreso para la mantencion de su familia, la que esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, necesita este financiamiento para realizar la construccion de un cuarto anexo en su casa de habitación y ampliar el tamaño y asi poder ofrecer condiciones que le permitan vivir en mejor comodidad con sus hijos y su esposa, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre progresivo, trabajador y responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño, sus metas y proyecciones.
texts.en:
Hector lives in Nueva Guinea. He has been working as a truck driver for the Ponderosa ranch for four years. This is his primary source of income to support his family. His family is comprised of his wife and two minor children. He needs this loan to build a room onto his house and expand its size. That way he will be able to provide his wife and children with more comfortable living conditions. In his community he is considered to be a progressive, hard-working, and responsible man. He hopes to receive a Kiva loan be able to make his dream, goals, and projections a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room onto his house

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Mr A. Kossi est né en 1988 à Kpalimé. Il réside actuellement à Gapé Atchanvé. Il n’eut pas la chance de poursuivre ses études secondaires fautes de soutien. Pour se prendre en charge, il fait le commerce ambulant de villages en villages en vendant de produits de premières nécessités notamment les pâtes alimentaires, savons, boîtes de conserves et autres. Son objectif est d’ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est à cette fin qu’il sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir à s’installer et à approvisionner sa boutique en marchandises (savons, pâtes alimentaires, huiles, boîtes de conserves et autres) sur la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mr A. Kossi est né en 1988 à Kpalimé. Il réside actuellement à Gapé Atchanvé. Il n’eut pas la chance de poursuivre ses études secondaires fautes de soutien. Pour se prendre en charge, il fait le commerce ambulant de villages en villages en vendant de produits de premières nécessités notamment les pâtes alimentaires, savons, boîtes de conserves et autres. Son objectif est d’ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est à cette fin qu’il sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir à s’installer et à approvisionner sa boutique en marchandises (savons, pâtes alimentaires, huiles, boîtes de conserves et autres) sur la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale et l'approvisionner

loans.name: Nana  Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua E. is a widow with two children. She has not received any formal education. Nana sells maize and prepares 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) for sale at Elmina. Nana uses her income to take care of herself and the family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. prepares 'banku' at Elmina. Araba has received senior high education. She is divorced and has two children. Araba has been selling 'banku' (a local dish made of fermented corn dough) for ten years now. She responsibly uses her income to educate and feed the household. Her loan will be used to purchase more bags of maize for 'banku'. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the cooking of other foods to bring variety into her cooking.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize for 'banku'

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Mme A. Amah est née en 1979 à Gapé Agodokpé oû elle réside encore dans le Zio. Abandonnant très tôt ses études primaires, elle se livre aux travaux champêtres. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est très  attachée à son activité agricole qui lui procure des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols.
texts.en: Mme A. Amah est née en 1979 à Gapé Agodokpé oû elle réside encore dans le Zio. Abandonnant très tôt ses études primaires, elle se livre aux travaux champêtres. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est très  attachée à son activité agricole qui lui procure des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols.

loans.use: accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols

loans.name: El Arca Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Arca está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Rosa Emilia L. quien comercializa tropigas desde hace 20 años y desea aumentar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa Argentina Caldera tiene un pequeño restaurante y Fátima del Rosario L. comercializa cosméticos, calcomanías y premios.
texts.en:
The Arca group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Rosa Emilia L. is one of them. She has been selling propane tanks for 20 years, and she wants to expand her business. Rosa Argentina Caldera, also a member, has a small restaurant. Fátima del Rosario L. is the third member. She sells cosmetics, stickers, and prizes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.
texts.en: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.use: augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.name: Focus Group

texts.en:
Amos K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Focus.  He is 32 years old single, and has two children who are between the ages of nine-months and three years. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For five years, he has been operating a foreign exchange bureau and selling phone cards in Thinkers' Village on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. 

He describes himself as determined man whose goals are to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes E. is a seamstress and also prepares porridge for sale at Elmina.  She has not been to school. She is married to a driver and together they live with their five dependents. She feeds her family as a way of helping her husband support the family. Her loan will be used to buy more materials and cloth to sew for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop in town to sew in.

loans.use: buy more materials and cloth to sew for sale

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Née en 1979 à Gapé–Afomekponawoé, Mme Mama A. est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est un cultivatrice très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans l’agriculture avec ses propres moyens financiers. Ambitieuse et très déterminée, elle sollicite un financement en vue d’étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles pour de meilleurs rendements et des revenus agricoles conséquents. Sa bonne réputation et bonne foi méritent d’être récompensées.
texts.en: Née en 1979 à Gapé–Afomekponawoé, Mme Mama A. est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est un cultivatrice très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans l’agriculture avec ses propres moyens financiers. Ambitieuse et très déterminée, elle sollicite un financement en vue d’étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles pour de meilleurs rendements et des revenus agricoles conséquents. Sa bonne réputation et bonne foi méritent d’être récompensées.

loans.use: étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa L. is a widow who lives in Hda. Claudio, Poblacion II, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by a food vending  business.  She has 5 children who are 16 to  32 years old, with 2 of her children having their own families, 1 works and 1 is currently studying. 

Josefa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19000, which she intends to use to purchase of more food to sell so that she could continue to save up for future security of her family and her youngest child's education. Josefa L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more food to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Adjoa uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase extra bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to plough back her profit into her business.

loans.use: purchase extra bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe J. is a 37-year old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a food vending business. She lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Ma. Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Ma. Fe is now borrowing PHP 11000 so that she could have a larger working capital, which will enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Fe aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Tuburan, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Federico E., who is 55 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have 10 children, who are between the ages of 12 and 33. Maria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to purchase fishing nets for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family. Maria E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt and gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.ru:
Ilhama T. G. I. 41 dog. Ona imeyet 3 detey, strashaya dochka 19 let kotoraya uchitsya v universitete ,dochka 17 let uchitsya v shkole  i sin 14 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Ilhama yavlyayetsya IDP personoy ,ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli ,seychas projivayet v Khirdalane. 

Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ilhami. Ona uje 1 qod kak pomenyala svoy bizness i seychas ona uje imeyet maqazin ryadom so svoim domom qde prodayet odejdu. Seychas Ilhama nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi rasshirit pomesheniye i razvit svoy bizness.
texts.en:
Ilham T. G. I. is 41 years old. She has three children: her eldest daughter, 19 years old, who is a university student; a 17-year old daughter who is a high school student; and a 14-year old son who also attends school and practices sports. Ilhama is an Internally Displaced Person; she is a refugree from the Fuzuli region and currently lives in Khurdalan. This is Ilhama’s second loan. A year ago she changed her place of business; now she has a clothing store next to her home. At present Ilhana needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her facility and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en: Comfort K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Our God Is Able'. She is 44 years old, is married, and has six children who are between the ages of 6 and 24. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. For twelve years, she has been selling fashion clothes, such as blouses, skirts and other clothes, at the Thinkers’ Village Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more fashion clothes. She describes herself as a respectful woman whose goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 41 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de restaurante. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este negocio vendiendo mariscos en rio San Juan por lo que aprendió a elaborar diferentes platillos pues siempre está pendiente de complacer a sus clientes, pues él es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de realizar esta actividad, lo que más le gusta es complacer a sus clientes. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, carnes, pollo, pescado entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Saul is 41 years old and has had a restaurant for more than 10 years. He started the business selling shellfish by the San Juan River, learning to prepare different dishes. He is always looking to please his customers, for he is a very responsible man who enjoys his work. What he likes most is to please his customers. He is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, produce, meat, chicken, fish, among other things needed to prepare his succulent dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Unidad está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Rosa Argentina C. M. quien tiene una kiosco en un colegio desde hace 11 años. Ella tiene 8 hijos pero solo cuatro están a su cargo 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gloria Elena S. Hernández quien tiene una mini panadería y comercializa productos Avon mientras Cecilia Alvarado tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group known as Unity is made up of three hard-working, assertive women. One of them is Rosa Argentina Calera, who has had a kiosk at a high school for the last 11 years. She has 8 children, but is responsible for only four of them. The other members of the group are Gloria Elena Sanchez Hernandez, who has a small bakery and sells Avon products. Cecilia Alvarado has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: En chiverias, gaseosas, pan, reposterias etc.

loans.name: Virginia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Virginia de 46 años, trabaja con su esposo haciendo carreras en su camión, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Para tener un ingreso mas sostenible para su casa, Virginia y su esposo invirtieron sus ahorros en un camión para hacer carreras y fletes. Poco a poco han podido solventar su hogar, trabajan desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques y así readecuar el cuarto de sus hijas. En el futuro quiere tener mas clientela para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old, and works with her husband making the rounds in his truck. She lives in an area on the urban fringe known as Duran, an area in decay. In order to have more income to maintain their household, Virginia and her husband invested their savings in a truck to make deliveries and haul freight. Little by little, they have been able to pay for their home. They work from early morning until nightfall. With the loan, she wants to buy building materials, such as cement, paint, blocks, and renovate her daughters’ room. In the future, she hopes to have a larger customer base in order to provide a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cemento, pinturas, bloques

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of ladies hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa B. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Adjoa sells rice and cosmetics at Elmina by moving from one area to another. Her husband is a mason. Adjoa uses her income to help her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to save to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery A. sells 'kenkey' and charcoal at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Mery has been in this business for eight years. Her husband is a security man. Mery uses her income to help her husband in feeding, clothing and sheltering her family. Mery will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) for distribution. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mery plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es: El Sr. Rómulo vive en la localidad de el Torno distante 40km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, capital de los Valles Bolivianos, es de ocupación albañil, trabaja en las construcciones de viviendas, y también  comercia con hojas medicinales, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su vivienda, tiene dos hijos los cuales viven con su madre, por que son separados, por tal motivo el le pasa pensión mensual para sus dos hijitos, cuenta que esta situación es difícil para el ya que tiene los fines de semana para ver a sus hijitos, después de fracasar en su matrimonio le costo reponerse, nuevamente esta saliendo adelante, y agradece a la institución por darle ese apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
Romulo lives in the El Torno area, located 40 km. from Santa Cruz. He was born in the department of Cochabamba, capital of Los Valles Bolivianos. He is a brick layer, and works in residential construction. He also markets medicinal herbs. The purpose of the loan is to finish building his house. He has two children, who live with their mother. They are separated, and he pays monthly child support for his two little children. He reports that the situation is hard for him, since he has weekends to see his children. After his marriage failed, it was difficult for him to get back on the ground. He is making progress once more, and thanks the institution for providing this financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La Construccion  de su Vivienda

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells panties, dresses and body creams at Elmina. Araba has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. She is responsible for feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy various body creams for sale. She hopes to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy various body creams for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Visión hacia el Futuro está con formado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Raquel M. quien vende ropa, zapatos y comida desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el crédito para reforzamiento de su negocio.   

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Arling E. vende prendas, Karla O. es cortera, Lisbeth  C. vende ropa y sabanas y Carol L. comercializa ropa y comida rápida.
texts.en:
The group "Visión Hacia el Futuro" (Vision Towards the Future) is comprised of 5 hardworking women. One is Raquel M., who has sold clothing, shoes and food for the last 10 years. She will invest her loan to strengthen her business. The other group members are Arling E., who sells undergarments, Karla O., a hair stylist, Lisbeth C., who sells clothing and bed linens, and Carol L., who sells clothing and fast food.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business merchandise, such as clothing, shoes and food.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a seamstress at Elmina. Aba has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been in this business for six years. She responsibly helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cloth to display and to sew. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy cloth to display and to sew

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells bowls and utensils at Elmina by moving from one area to another. Esi has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has one child. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to build a shop to display her goods in.

loans.use: buy extra utensils to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua Y. is a widow. She produces 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) to sell at Elmina. Efua wants the loan to enable her to produce in larger quantities so she can distribute to her increasing customer base. She has been in this trade for forty years. Efua uses her income to take care of herself. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more maize to cook for sale

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lucila del Socorro Ramírez es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la producción de queques y la venta de cosméticos Avon y Romanel desde hace 4 años. Ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella.

R. ha sido beneficiada tanto por los créditos con por las capacitaciones que según expreso le han ayudado a desarrollarse  y a mejorar su negocio, la atención etc.
texts.en:
Lucila del Socorro Ramírez is a hard-working woman who makes cakes and has sold Avon and Romanel cosmetics for four years. She has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Ms. Ramírez has been helped equally by the loans she has received and by the skills she has learned, to help her develop herself and improve her business, customer service, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make cakes and sell cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets for trapping crabs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 23 años, vive con su pequeña hija en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de la marca más reconocida en el mercado, por lo que es ofrecida a sus clientes por medio de catálogos y muestras. Además el trato que brinda a su clientela es personalizada, ya que siempre los visita a su casa o centro de trabajo, eso le da mucha ventaja para vender sus productos, luego ya realiza los respectivo cobros de acuerdo al tiempo convenido que tuvieron. Le agrada trabajar  en su negocio porque le permite tener las ganancias que necesita para mantener a su hija, sin embargo corre el riesgo de de vender su mercadería a personas que no pagan. Su mayor anhelo es tener un stand de ventas, donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y más servicios como un locutorio, o un estudio de fotografía. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y perfumes ya que al por mayor se están ofertando a un precio bajo, asimismo desea comprar una cámara fotográfica para incursionar en el negocio del servicio de fotografía.
texts.en:
Marisol is 23 years old and lives with her young daughter at her parents’ house. For the past three years she’s been selling a well-known brand of beauty products through catalogs and samples. She offers personalized service to her customers and visits them in their homes or places of work. This gives her a great advantage in her sales. She then collects payment according to the agreed upon terms. She likes working in her business because it allows her to have the income she needs to support her daughter, but she still risks selling to people who will not make their payments. Her greatest desire is to have a stand where she can offer a greater amount of products and more services, such as announcements or photography. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support, now that they know that she is responsible with her payments.
