She is also happy to be part of a communal bank because she knows all of the members and they are all united and responsible people. She is also grateful to those who make this loan possible, which will be very helpful to her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in cosmetics and perfumes, because they are being offered at a lower price when purchased in quantity. She also wants to buy a camera so that she can begin her photography business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa T. cooks 'Fante kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough sold wrapped in banana leaves) at Elmina.  Adjoa has received junior high education. She is divorced and has two children. She responsibly takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy a bag of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy a bag of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Yaly

texts.es: La Sra. YALY vive en la zona de la radial 10,  tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella es madre soltera, se dedica a la panadería desde hace 10 años. Ella sola se esfuerza para salir adelante con el apoyo de sus padres. Ella por las noches estudia en un instituto una carrera técnica desea graduarse y ejercer su carrera,  el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar otro horno de panadería porque tiene mucha demanda, la Sra. es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de superación  para darle un futuro a su hijo, la Sra. Yaly es colaborada por su hermana en la elaboración y comercialización de los riquísimos panes.
texts.en:
Ms. Yaly lives in the Radial 10 zone. She has a school-aged son and is a single mother. She has been running a bread-baking business for ten years. With the support of her parents, she strives to move forward. At night, she takes classes at a technical school. She hopes to graduate and to use her studies. The loan she is requesting is to buy another bakery oven, because there is a lot of demand for her bread. Ms. Yaly is someone who has great hopes of improving her lot, in order to give her son a better future. Ms. Yaly works alongside her sister to bake and sell their delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy another oven for her bread bakery

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Aba sells 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) and fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Aba uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She sells charcoal and firewood at Elmina. Ekua has attained junior high level of education. Ekua uses her income to help her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. She will use the loan to purchase additional bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to build a storehouse for her charcoal.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Ali K. 44 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey  doch 18 let kotoraya v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 16 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona ,seychas projivayet v Khirdalan qorode. 

Eto uje vtoroya ssuda Ali on ochen blagodaren za pervuyu ssudu za to chto lenderi pomoqli yemu i yeqo biznessu. Ali 1 qod tomu nazad nachal noviy bizness ,on otkril "internet club". Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi rasshirit pomesheniye chtobi on smoq pomestit bolshe kompyuterov.
texts.en:
Ali K. is 44 years old. He is married, with two children: an 18-year old daughter who has been admitted to the university this year and a 16-year old son who goes to school. Ali is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Kalbadjar Region. He currently lives in the town of Khirdalan. This is Ali’s second loan. He is very grateful for his first loan and for lenders’ help with his business. A year ago he launched a new business, opening an “Internet club.” At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his facility and be able to accommodate more computers.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding his facility

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama E. is single. She is a hairdresser by profession but goes round the neighborhood to sell utensils at Elmina. She has received a junior high level education. Ama uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of herself. Ama will use the loan to purchase more utensils to sell. With the new revenue from her business, she plans to revive her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. is married and has a child. She has been through senior high school. Araba sells charcoal and kitchen utensils at Elmina. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband is a driver. Araba uses her income to help her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family. Araba will use the loan to purchase extra bags of charcoal and utensils to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to build a store house for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase extra bags of charcoal and utensils to sell

loans.name: Yiyo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yiyo está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Olga Marina L. vende leña desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene la meta de invertir en otros negocios como una pequeña venta. 
 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Iveth L. comercializa ropa hace 5 años y Maritza O. L. vende pan desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Yiyo Group is made up of three hard-working and spirited women. One of them is Olga Marina L., who has been selling firewood for six years. She has a goal of investing in other businesses, such as a small store. The other members of the Yiyo Group are Iveth L., who has been selling clothing for 5 years, and Maritza O. L., who has been selling bread for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cooking utensils to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells foodstuffs and maize at Elmina. Efua has not been to school. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is into galamsay (gold mining in rural Ghana). Efua has been in this business for twelve years. She responsibly helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Marina es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, Marina tiene un restaurante en su casa en donD. además venD. bebidas, actividad con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Además Marina junto a sus hijos tienen una carpintería en su casa.
Marina solicita un crédito D. 2000 soles para la compra D. gallina, gaseosas y cerveza.
Los sueños D. Marina son ampliar su restaurante y ampliar un carro para pasear.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the "Las Golondrinas" ["The Swallows"] communal bank. Marina is married and has four children, of which three are in school. Marina has a restaurant in her house, where she also sells drinks. Her husband and children help her with the business. Together with her children, Marina also has a carpentry shop in their house. Marina is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer. Marina's dream is to expand her restaurant and to add a cart for selling on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia A. sells slippers and fish at Elmina. Patricia has no formal educational background. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a plumber. She has been selling slippers and fish for six years now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to revive her fish business.

loans.use: buy more slippers for sale

loans.name: Nana Efua

texts.en: Nana Efua A. sells corn dough at Elmina. Nana has been through senior high school. She is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy a bag of maize to prepare corn dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy a bag of maize to prepare corn dough for sale

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.es:
Karina es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Karina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos y accesorios de carros, actividad que inicio hace 4 años.
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de fajas.
Karina sueña con construir su casa porque vive en la casa de sus suegros y ampliar su negocio con la implementación de un taller.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are in school. Karina rents a store where she sells spare parts and car accessories. She started doing this four years ago. Karina is a member of the "Las Golondrinas" ["The Swallows"] communal bank and she is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy timing belts. Karina dreams of building her own house, because she currently lives in her in-laws' house. She also dreams of expanding her business by opening a workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy timing belts

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica al servicio de costura, elaborando las bases para sombreros, fustanes entre otras prendas típicas de su zona. De esta manera realiza este servicio acompañada de su herramienta, que es su maquina de coser, puesto que los clientes le proporcionan tela y demás materiales para elaborar su trabajo. Manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en  la costura porque para ella es un pasatiempo que le genera buenas rentas a la vez. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de animales y al cultivo de papa, maíz, habas y arveja, pero cuando es temporada de  siembra y cosecha es donde más esfuerzos requieren para poder realizar un buen trabajo, asimismo lo que cosecha es vendido en el mercado de su ciudad.  Por el momento desea extender sus cultivos en terrenos que posee, así mismo tener un taller de costura con maquinas de ultima generación para facilitar el trabajo de costura. Es su crédito numero catorce con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y la reparación de su máquina de coser, asimismo desea comprar una terreno más amplio para aumentar su productividad.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 42, lives with her husband and six children in her own house. For over three years she has been a seamstress. She makes bases for hats and women’s skirts among other typical items of clothing from her area. She carries out these tasks with help from her work tool: a sewing machine. Her customers supply the other supplies like fabric. She states that she enjoys sewing because for her it’s a hobby that also produces profits at the same time. On the other hand, she also raises small farm animals and farms corn, lima beans and peas. When planting and harvest times come is when the hardest effort is required to do a good job. The crops are sold in the city market. For now, she’d like to extend her fields as well as have a workshop with the latest model sewing machines to facilitate the jobs. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help since she has always been very responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually-supportive people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan that will be very useful for her to continue with her business. She will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts and repair her sewing machine. She also wants to buy more farmland to increase productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, tomatoes, beans, red oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es:
Ania es una pequeña comerciante, que ha venido creciendo gracias a su tenacidad y empeño al negocio una pulpería que comenzó con liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Y con el apoyo de su esposo, siendo policía.
Aun no tiene casa, alquila y ese es su proyecto que tiene tener una casa propia.
Afodenic ha aportado para que su negocio crezca y está contenta porque está logrando el objetivo de crecer como comerciante.
Comprara: Granos básicos, lácteos, carne, pollo, golosinas, para aumentar el inventario y mejorar las ventas e ir ahorrando.
texts.en:
Ania is a small businesswoman who, thanks to her tenacity and determination, has been growing her pulpería [small grocery store] business. With the help of her husband, a policeman, she started the pulpería when her previous job was eliminated. She does not have a house, as she is a renter, but her goal is to have her own house. AFODENIC has supported her so that her business could grow, and she is happy because she is achieving her goal of growing as a businesswoman. She will buy: basic grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, and candies, in order to increase her inventory, improve her sales, and continue saving.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, and candy (to improve sales)

loans.name: Calidez Group

texts.es:
El grupo Calidez está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Olga S. de 60 años quien desde el 2002 tiene una pequeña venta  la cual ha invertido y desea que crezca.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Alicia L. Sandobal quien vende nacatamales y Magali Nohemí G. comercializa leña desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Calidez ["Warmth"] Group is made up of three hard-working and spirited women. One of them is 60 year-old Olga S., who has had a small store since 2002. She has invested in it and hopes that it will grow. The other members of the group are Alicia L. Sandobal, who sells nacatamales [steamed corn cakes wrapped in banana leaves] and Magaly Nohemí G., who has sold firewood for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glue and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows (for milk and meat)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado dedicada a la agricultura, que junto a su esposo trabajan diariamente sembrando y cosechando verduras, tubérculos y flores, productos que son muy  cotizados en su zona. El tiempo que espera para la cosecha es de 6 meses, logrando obtener la cantidad suficiente para su comercialización, generándole las ganancias que necesita para el sostenimiento de su familia. A pesar de que las actividades agrícolas son muy sacrificadas  siempre ha  disfrutado de hacerlo ya que le agrada vivir en la zona rural y esta es la razón que la motiva a continuar  adelante, con el anhelo de incrementar su producción agrícola. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their four children in a home they own. She's worked in farming all her life, and she and her husband work every day planting and harvesting vegetables, tubers, and flowers, with are in high demand in their region. It's 6 months from sowing to harvest, and she can grow enough to sell and earn an income to support her family. Even though farming is very difficult, she's always enjoyed it and likes living in a rural area, so she intends to keep going, hoping to increase her agricultural production. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and it makes her happy to know she has financial support, since she's always been responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her village bank because all of the other members are responsible, supportive people. She is grateful to all the people who will contribute to the loan she's requested, which will be very useful to her in improving her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Evelyn Leonor

texts.es:
Evelyn de 27 años, es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras) vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo. 

Debido a su divorcio ella tubo que comenzar a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, escucho de Yambal y se inscribió como vendedora a domicilio por catalogo. Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos. Vende perfumes, cremas, etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y otra parte dirigirla para comprar una cocina y sillas y así vender almuerzos.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 27, sells Yambal products (Yambal is a cosmetics company that sells low-cost products to female entrepreneurs). She lives with her two children in an urban area called Guasmo. Due to a divorce, she had to start looking for a way to make an income so she could support her children. She heard of Yambal and signed up as a vendor who sells at home through catalogs. Little by little she has made an income to cover her expenses. She sells perfumes, creams, etc. In order to keep her business going, she will use part of the loan to buy perfumes and creams, and the other part to buy a kitchen and chairs so that she can also sell lunches.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and a kitchen

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa de Guadalupe está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Martha C. quien vende ropa desde hace 5 años. Negocio en el que invertirá el crédito y el cual desea mejorar especialmente tener su propia tienda.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Liseth R. de 36 años vende desde helados, refrescos y helados y José Angel C. quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Rosa de Guadalupe Group is made up of three hardworking and dedicated individuals. One of them is Martha C. who has been selling clothing for the past five years. She will invest the loan into her business which she hopes to improve by having her own store. The other group members are Liseth R., 36, who sells ice cream and soft drinks, and José Angel C., who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise such as clothing

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, desde entonces trabaja a diario en los terrenos que le fue heredado por sus padres, sembrando principalmente papa, maíz, arveja y flores, en tanto su esposo se encarga de realiza los trabajos más fuertes, mientras que vende los productos ya cosechados. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura porque le permite tener siempre disponible en su despensa los alimentos necesarios, por otro lado cría animales como carneros, cerdos y cuyes. Su pan próximo es procurar aumentar la productividad de lo que cultiva, es por ello que desea extender el espacio que siembra así podrá aumentar su cosecha. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Nely, 26, lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. Since childhood she has been a farmer. Since then she has worked the fields daily that her parents passed on to her farming primarily potatoes, corn, peas and flowers. Her husband does the heaviest work and sells the harvested crops. She states that she likes farming because it allows her to always have food available. She also raises small farm animals like sheep, pigs and guinea pigs.Her future plan is to increase farm productivity so she wants to expand the area she plants. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy sacks of manure and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and seed.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: La señora Adilia F. D., tiene la edad de 30 años vive en el barrio Waspan Norte, es casada y su esposo labora como operario de zona franca, y con sus ingresos apoya a los gastos mensuales del hogar, tienen un hijo menor de edad, ella vende ropa usada y cosméticos tiene 3 años de ganarse la vida de esta manera, por los problemas económicos del país, las vendas a veces bajan y suben, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita mejores condiciones económicas, esta inversión le permitirá a futuro la compra de un terreno donde ir edificando su hogar, un hogar digno cómodo, y seguro que permita un desarrollo optimo en la vida de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Sra. Adilia F. D. is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Waspan Norte. She is married and her husband works as an operator in the free trade district. With the income she earns, Adilia is able to help with the monthly household expenses. They have a young child.

Adilia has been selling used clothing and cosmetics for three years to earn a living. Due to the economic problems occurring in the country, her sales occasionally rise and fall. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a larger inventory of merchandise to improve her financial situation. This investment will allow her in the future to buy land where she can build a decent and comfortable home. She is confident that this will help her provide an optimal environment in which her child can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO (en langue national sénégalaise) signifie entente entre les membre en français. Il est crée depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite. Il regroupe 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et toutes vendeuses au marché du quartier.

Madame Seynabou M., assise à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, élevant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée d'une cinquantaine d'année. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait du commerce depuis son entrée dans le Banc Villageois. 

Avec son financement de 100.000 francs cfa elle va acheter des tissus en wax et basin qu'elle va revendre à crédit et/ou au comptant dans son quartier et au marché. 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux, tels que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et une participation à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO (in Senegal’s national language) signifies harmony between members in French. It was created after the inauguration of the WANGO Banc Villageois where it is based. It consists of 7 women who live in the same neighborhood and are merchants at the neighborhood market. Mrs. Seynabou M., seated at the extreme left in the photo raising her right hand, is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She has been in business since joining the Banc Villageois. With financing of 100,000 CFA, she is going to buy wax and basin (damask) fabric that she will sell in her neighborhood and at the market for cash or on credit. Her goal is to provide for her family’s needs, such as her children’s school fees and contributions to daily expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax and damask fabrics

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr:
Madame MBAYANG G. est une femme de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois (3) autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BABACK, dont elle est la trésorière depuis 1997. Elle a 26 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle fait essentiellement de l'embouche ovine et bovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d'une décennie. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des moutons et des bœufs qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son commerce afin de promouvoir son épargne. Elle participe financièrement à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbayang G. is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of ten. She also has three other children in her care, entrusted to her by relatives. She is a member of Banc Villageois of Baback and has been its treasurer since 1997. She obtained loans 26 times and never had problems repaying them. Her main line of work is raising sheep and cattle. She has been doing this for over ten years. With her new loan she will purchase sheep and cows in order to fatten them for resale in about five months. Her goal is to strengthen her business and to be able to put away some savings. She makes a financial contribution to the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep and cattle

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector San Isidro Desaguadero del caserío Calazán, una zona rural del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años  a la venta de pan y leche en una esquina de uno de los barrios ubicados cerca al centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella realiza esta actividad diariamente y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en la zona ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados. El pan lo adquiere en la zona donde vive y la leche la extrae de una vaca que cría en su casa. Este negocio le sirve para poyar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Yrene desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la venta de productos derivados de la leche como queso y mantequilla y también en diversos embutidos como jamón y salchicha. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante alegre y amable. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior.
texts.en:
Yrene is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and four children in the San Isidro Desaguadero sector of the village of Calazán, a rural area in the district of Monsefú. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past ten years, Yrene has been selling bread and milk at a street corner in one of the neighborhoods near the central part of the city of Chiclayo. She engages in her business every day and has built up a group of loyal customers throughout the time she has been working. The bread is acquired in the area where she lives and the milk comes from a cow that she raises at home. This business enables her to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses.

Yrene wants to expand her business by venturing into the sale of other dairy products such as cheese and butter. In addition, she wants to sell different cured meats such as ham and sausage. To accomplish these objectives, she has decided to apply for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Yrene is a cheerful and friendly woman. Her neighbors and customers have great respect for her and consider her to be a woman who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study for a college degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products & cured meats

loans.name: Soukeye

texts.fr:
Madame SOUKEYE F. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BABACK depuis 1997. Elle a 26 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus et de couscous. Pour le couscous, elle achète du mil et le transforme en couscous avant de le vendre par mesures dans le village.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter son niveau approvisionnement en tissus et acheter des sacs de mil pour augmenter sa production et réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille tout en renforçant ses épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
Mrs Soukeye F. is a 50-year old woman. She is married and the mother of five children in her care. She has also another child in her care that has been entrusted to her by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Baback since 1997. She took out 26 consecutive loans and never had a problem with repayments. She is the owner of a small store and sells cloths and couscous. To get couscous, she buys millet and transforms it to couscous before selling it loosely in her village. She will use her new loan to expand her supply of cloths and buy sacks of millet to increase her couscous production and earn more profit. Her aim is to support her husband in providing for the household expenses of the family, and at the same time to increase her savings within the Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloths and millet

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Julio vive en la localidad de San José municipio de la Guardia, distante a 29 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es separado, tiene un hijo, a quien le ayuda con una pensión mensual, es de ocupación chofer propietario, brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros de la ciudad de Santa Cruz a la localidad de el torno, el destino del crédito es para cambiar el motor de su vehículo que se encuentra en mal estado, es nacido en el la provincia Caballero de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 4 años que se dedica al transporte, le va muy bien ya que se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para trabajar, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the la Guardia district of San José, located 29 km from the city of Santa Cruz. He is separated and has one child, who receives a monthly payment from him. He owns a car and drives passengers from Santa Cruz to his area. He will use the loan to change his vehicle's motor, which is in bad shape. Julio was born in Santa Cruz's Caballero province. He has been working in transport for four years and is so doing well that he has to get up early to go to work. He is grateful for the support he has received from the Emprender microfinance partner.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motor

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza  nace hace poco mas de 1 año para tener acceso al crédito y demás servicios que ofrecen la fundación.
Se unieron varias vecinas que se conocen desde hace varios años y a partir de ahí tomaron el habito de reunirse todos los domingos por las tardes, se ayudan bastante y todas juntas están aprendiendo a construir su comité. 
La Sra. Emilia es una de las integrante y se dedica a la venta de ropas y teniendo en cuenta la llegada de la nueva estación deséa incrementar sus ingresos adquiriendo en cantidades a precios de mayoristas, ropas de temporada primavera-verano y así aumentar sus ganancias, abaratando los precios de costo.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo y desea seguir haciendolo ya que le ayuda bastante para los gasto de la familia.
Su puesto de venta lo tiene en su casa y tambien recorre en la casa de conocidos para vender sus mercaderias, ella recurre a distintas formas de vender para aumentar sus ingresos y comenta que los creditos la ayudan para renovar sus mercaderias.
texts.en:
The committee called “La Esperanza” (The Hope) was established more than a year ago so that the members could access credit and other services offered by Fundacion Paraguaya. The group consists of different neighbors who have known one another for several years. They are accustomed to the habit of meeting every Sunday afternoon so that they could help one another and learn how to build their committee.

Sra. Emilia is one of the members who sell clothing. With the arrival of a new season, she wants to increase her earnings by purchasing in quantity so that she can obtain the wholesale price. By acquiring clothes for spring and summer at a lower cost, she hopes to generate more revenue. Emilia has been in this business for some time and wants to continue so that she can help with the family expenses.

Her vending post is located at her house, but she also travels to the homes of her acquaintances to sell her merchandise. Emilia finds different ways of selling her goods in order to increase her profits. She says the loans have helped her replenish her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Medalit

texts.es:
Medalit tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en elsector San Isidro Desaguadero del caserío Calazán ubicado en el distrito de Monsefú, a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo y uso diario que contribuyen a facilitar sus vidas diarias. El negocio goza de buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

Medalit desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayor cantidad de ingresos, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante responsable y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien tranquila y coanfiable.
texts.en:
Medalit is 30 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the San Isidro Desaguadero neighborhood of the Calazán hamlet in the Monsefú district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years, she has been selling necessaries and groceries from a shop attached to her house. She offers her clients many consumer products that they use regularly. The business does well thanks to her good service and the quality of the products she offers. She uses the income to help her parents meet the everyday costs of their family. Medalit wants to expand her business and buy more products so that she can make more sales and thus more money. For this reason, she is seeking her first loan with the microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very responsible young woman who enjoys her work, and her neighbors and acquaintances find her trustworthy and reliable.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy good to increase the stock for the store attached to her house

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel de 29 años de edad se dedica al rubro de Vendedor Ambulante  hace 8 años aproximadamente esta casado con la señora Antonia Aliendre de 47 años de edad.
    El señor Miguel inició su microempresa con la venta de un rodado que lo ayudo a tener Capital y comprar artículos de primera necesidad, y realizar las ventas en las ciudades de Raul Arsenio Oviedo, Toledo, Campo 9, Repatri8acion, Yhu, Vaqueria, San Joaquin etc.
    Solicito el crédito para la compra de harina, fiambre, aceite, azúcar, bijouteria, golosina etc. , para volver a venderlo con buen margen de ganancia.
    Espera un futuro mejor para nuestro pais con muchos lugares de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is 29 years old and has been working as a street vendor for approximately eight years. He is married to Sra. Antonia Aliendre who is 47 years of age.

Sr. Miguel started his micro-business by establishing a roadside stand which helped him generate capital to buy basic necessities. He conducts his sales in the cities of Raul Arsenio Oveido, Toledo, Campo 9, Repatriacion, Yhu, Vaqueria, San Joaquin, and other places.

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy flour, cold cuts, oil, sugar, trinkets, candies, and other products that he can sell at a good profit margin. He hopes for a better future and that there will be other places in the country where he can find work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, cold cuts, oil, sugar, trinkets, candies, and other products

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia vive en el Barrio Monte Alto de la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Sucre, hace 15 años que llego a la ciudad de Santa Cruz en busca de días mejores, su actividad principal es la venta de refrigerio como ser empanadas, café, chocolate , y otros acompañantes, su esposo con el cual tiene 1 hijo se dedica a la construcción de viviendas, el destino del crédito solicitado es para comprar una heladera para guardar sus alimentos y los insumos de su negocio, están pagando su vivienda por lo que tienen que trabar duro para cubrir la deuda y sostener a su familia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

OJO la Sra Celia aparece en la foto acompañada de su esposo y su hijito.
texts.en:
Celia lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood in community of La Guardia, 20 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She was born in the Sucre department. Fifiteen years ago she came to the city of Santa Cruz, seeking better days. Her main activity is selling snacks such as empanadas, coffee, chocolate, and other food. Her husband, with whom she has 1 child, works in home construction. The loan she has asked for will be used to buy a refrigerator to keep her food and her business' ingredients in. They are paying for their home and so have to work hard to cover the debt and support their family. She is very grateful with the institution for the support it has offered. Attention: Celia appears in the photo with her husband and son.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Jorge Ricardo

texts.es:
Jorge de 20 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Cuando murió su papa el se hizo cargo de la tienda que mantenía a toda su familia, desde ese tiempo el la ha administrado bien, vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, aceites y azúcar. Esta incluyendo en su tienda artículos para casa y productos de uso personal. 

El quiere seguir con su negocio para seguir ayudando a su mama y hermanas, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y azúcar. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y poder comprar un automóvil.
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old. He has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in an urban area called Guasmo. It is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal merchants. When his father dies, he took over the store that supported his whole family. Since then, he has managed it well, selling all types of groceries such as rice, oil, and sugar. He is inlcuding all types of household items and person use products. He wants to continue with his business to keep helping his mother and sisters. That it why he wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil and sugar. In the future, he wants to increase his business and be able to buy an automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, sugar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel B. de 25 años, esta soltero, vive con sus padres.
   Daniel se dedica a este rubro de ventas de celulares y accesorios hace 5 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.005; el comenzó trabajando con su padre en su negocio, después  decidió independizarse, sus estudios le favorecía, fue a comprar celulares para vender y ofrecía reparaciones en su local, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercadería, (celulares y accesorios para celulares).
Más adelante desea ampliar el negocio, en vender artículos de informática.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel B. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has been selling mobile phones and accessories for five years, since 2005. Daniel started working at his father’s business, but he later decided to become independent and pursue an education. He bought mobile phones to sell and offered repair services from his own shop where he has an established customer base.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise (mobile phones & accessories). Later on he wants to expand his business by selling computer supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones & accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de 2 vacas lecheras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de Ganado Lechero

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, who rents a space in a department store, has owned a small business selling women's clothing for the past five years. A good location and an absence of competition have contributed to Svetlana's success, and her goal is to start one additional location.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase her assortment of clothing. She hopes to receive additional income and invest most of it back into the business. Svetlana enjoys her business and hopes to develop it further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Próspero

texts.es:
Prospero C. O. es un  señor de 66 años de edad, ella vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada San Cristóbal Norte. Es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, y el café. 
Don Prospero tiene toda su vida de dedicarse a la agricultura de todo tipo de  hortalizas y a la producción de carne tanto de res como de cerdo. El asegura que con su experiencia ha logrado tener siempre los mejore productos, pero ahora el necesita un préstamo ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones)  Para la compra de 2 cerdas para aumentar la producción de carne de cerdo y así mejorar sus ingresos. 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Prospero Coredero O., 66, lives with his wife and 2 children in a community named San Cristobal Norte. It is in a fairly mountainous area where people engage in things like business, agriculture, and coffee. Mr. O. has dedicated his entire life to growing all types of vegetables and producing meat, generally from cows and pigs. He believes that with his experience he has always been able to have the best products, but now he needs a loan of 599,000 colones to buy 2 pigs in order to increase meat production and improve his income. He is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte [San Cristobal Norte Communal Credit Company] (SACRIN), one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. He has received 5 microloans previously and has paid them all off responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional pigs.

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabet

texts.es:
Vanessa de 30 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Desde pequeña ella vivió en un mundo rodeado de víveres ya que su familia tenia una tienda, cuando creció ella quiso seguir los mismo pasos de ellos y tener su tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo compro algunos víveres y los ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir surtiendo su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 30, lives in an urban area named Guasmo, notable for the majority of its inhabitants running informal businesses. From a young age she has lived in a world surrounded by groceries, since her family had a store. When she grew up, she decided to follow in their footsteps and have a store. Little by little with work she bought some groceries and she kept them in the front part of her house. Now she works from 7:00am until 9:00pm every day. To continue supplying her store she wants to buy at first rice, oil, and sugar. In the future she wants to grow her business and have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, sugar

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos Alfredo G. tiene 20 años de edad, reside en el Barrio Palmira del Municipio de San Esteban junto a su compañera de hogar y sus dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad. Es un joven trabajador y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Inició a trabajar desde los 12 años de edad porque sus padres no pudieron darle la oportunidad de estudiar. Carlos actualmente comercializa todo tipo de accesorios para celular, películas y lentes para el sol, los vende a diario de forma ambulante recorriendo a pie grandes distancias. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar cargadores, cobertores y películas y así surtir su negocio de nuevos y novedosos productos. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta es que se requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y que en esta temporada del año las lluvias son muy frecuentes y tiene que tener mucho cuidado con la mercancía porque si se le moja se le arruina. Su sueño es establecer su negocio en un local y llegar a ser un distribuidor autorizado de una compañía de telefonía celular para obtener mayores ganancias y así poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo G. is 20 years old, and resides in the Palmira neighborhood of the town of San Esteban, together with his live-in partner and their two children of 2 and 7. He is a hard-working young man, and is well-regarded by his neighbors. He began working at the age of 12 because his parents could not afford to send him to school. Presently, Carlos sells all kinds of accessories for cell phones, as well as movies and sunglasses. He sells them every day on foot, traveling large distances. He needs the loan to buy chargers, covers, and movies and thus supply his business with new and novel products. One of the difficulties he faces is that his job requires a lot of physical effort and that in this season it rains frequently, and he has to be very careful with his merchandise, because if it gets wet it is ruined. His dream is to set up his business in one place and become an authorized distributor for a cell phone company, so he can earn more and thus be able to build his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar accesorios para telefonos celulares

loans.name: Andres Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés de 39 años de edad casado hace 10 años, con  tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en el barrio Santa Rosa zona alto San Pedro. Su actividad Económica del Sr. Andres es la de fletar  sistema de luces de sonido, amplificación anima fiestas, se dedica al rubro hace 12 años, también cuenta con una actividad  secundaria como auxiliar contable. Su esposa  trabaja como jefe  de ventas en una empresa, así mismo ayudando con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo al sr. Andres es para la compra de (parlantes, cables juego de luces u otros), esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Andres is 39 years old, and has been married for 10 years, and has 3 school-age children. He lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of San Pedro. His business is renting light and sound systems and lighting for parties. He has had this business for 12 years. He also has a secondary job as an assistant accountant. His wife works as the head of sales for a store, thus helping with living expenses. The loan is for the purchase of speakers and more sets of lights. He is very thankful to the institution for the help he has been given.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a set of lights and speakers.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María de 62 años, vende artículos de plásticos en su casa o en ocasiones recorriendo las calles, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Inicio vendiendo los artículos plásticos a conocidos poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar mas mercadería, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días vendiendo platos, lavacaras, baldes a un bajo costo. 

Con el préstamo quiere continuar vendiendo mercadería por eso quiere comprar lavadoras, baldes y otros artículos plásticos. En el futuro quiere tener un puesto en el mercado para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 62, sells plastic articles from her house or sometimes on the street. She lives in an urban area named Guasmo, notable for the majority of its inhabitants running informal businesses. She began selling plastic articles to people she new, and little by little with work she was able to buy more merchandise, and now works from 8:00am until 1:00pm every day selling dishes, washbasins, and buckets at a low price. With the loan she wants to continue selling merchandise, so will buy washbasins, buckets, and other plastic articles. In the future she wants to have a stall in the market in order to have a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Platos, valdes

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo B. de 47 años de edad está casado hace 5 años con la señora Mercedes Samudio de 53 años, la pareja vivió en concubinato por el tiempo de 10 años y luego se casaron, cuenta con 2 hijos de los cuales uno  ya falleció cuando tenía 3 años y la otra tiene 13 años y está cursando el 8vo. Grado.
El señor Eduardo se dedica a la compra y ventas de hiervas medicinales desde hace 6 años, cuenta con varios proveedores que le entrega en cantidades y luego el señor tiene un comerciante que es mayorista que le compra todo sus productos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de mercaderias debido a que la cascara de naranjas está en su época y sus clientes  cuenta con mucho stock y para poder comprar todo recurre a nosotros para poder cumplir con todos.
texts.en:
Sr. Eduardo Bogardo is 47 years old and has been married for five years to Sra. Mercedes Samudio, age 53. This couple lived together for ten years before getting married. Eduardo and his wife have two children, one of whom died at the age of three. Their surviving daughter is 13 years old and in the eighth grade.

Sr. Eduardo has been buying and selling medicinal herbs for six years. He has several suppliers who deliver inventory in quantity. Later he sells them to a wholesale merchant who buys all of his products.

He is requesting this loan to buy more inventory, such as orange peel, that is in season. His suppliers have plenty of stock and he wants to buy everything. Therefore, he has returned to Fundación Paraguaya so that he can place his orders and acquire all he can.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase orange peel

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: La Sra. Katerine, es una ama de casa emprendedora que decidió emprender su propia actividad económica, montando una pequeña tienda de barrio, la Sra. Katerine cuenta con todo el apoyo de su esposo El Sr.  Miguel ya que desde hace bastante tiempo ella a venido colaborando con los gastos familiares. La Sra.  Katherine se acercó por nuestras instalaciones debido a la necesidad que tenía de ampliar y surtir su tienda, ya que en la zona cuenta con un gran número de clientes. Una vez hecha la investigación correspondiente se procedió a aceptar dicho crédito ya que la Sra. Katerine cuenta con un buen Historial Crediticio y con domicilio conocido en la Zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Katerine is an entrepreneurial housewife who decided to start her own business by opening a small neighborhood shop. Katerine has the support of her husband, Miguel, since for quite a while she has been helping him with the family's bills. Katerine approached our facilities due to the need to expand and stock her store since she has a great number of customers. Once the corresponding investigation was made, she proceeded to accept the loan since Katerine has a good credit history and has a known address in the May 1 area of town. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La Señorita Elida A. de 20 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres.
   Elida se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.007; ella comenzó con un pequeño capital que sus padres le dieron, comenzó  envasando y vendiendo especias,  con eso fue capitalizándose mas hasta que en la actualidad ya tiene un local en el mercado de la ciudad para mostrar sus productos. 
   Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías,(pantalones, camisas, remeras, blusas, calsas, championes, zapatos, etc.).
    Desea un país con más oportunidades para la gente que desea progresar.
texts.en:
Srta. Elida A. is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has been selling articles of clothing for more than three years, since 2007. Elida started with a small amount of capital that was given to her by her parents. She started packaging and selling spices and used her earnings to acquire the shop she currently has in the city market where she displays her products.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise (trousers, shirts, T-shirts, blouses, track pants, athletic footwear, shoes, and other items). Elida hopes the country will have more opportunities for those who want to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, T-shirts, blouses, track pants, athletic footwear, shoes, and other items

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Fátima L. es una joven mujer trabajadora quien inicio hace seis años con la venta de ropa usada: negocio que con el arduo trabajo y los créditos ha ido prosperando actualmente  además de la ropa tiene una fritanga.

Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de pacas de ropa, granos básicos, carne, carbón, aceite, repollo etc. para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Fátima L. is a hardworking young person who started a used clothing business 6 years ago. Thanks to her very hard work and some loans, the business has prospered. Now, in addition to her clothing business, she has a business selling fried food. She will use the loan to purchase of bales of clothing, staple grains, meat, coal, cooking oil, cabbage, etc. so that she can continue to grow her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and also staple grains, meat, and other supplies

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su suegra. Desde hace 10 años que se dedica a realizar telares artesanales en la casa de su madre donde tiene un taller. Desde entonces los tejidos que elabora, lo hace con la mayor delicadeza a fin de que su clientela se sienta satisfecha por el servicio que presta. Actualmente hace telares de pequeñas cintas que se utilizan como accesorios en los trajes típicos de su zona y de esta manera logra tener los ingresos económicos para su hogar, adicionalmente a esto también se dedica a la agricultura y  crianza de animales que es complementario a su trabajo y le ayudan para  tener siempre disponible los alimentos que necesita. Su gran deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo. Este es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana al por mayor de distintas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Edy is 31 years old and lives with at her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and two children. For the past ten years, she has been producing hand-woven crafts from a workshop at her mother’s house. The items she produces are made with the utmost care and her customers are very satisfied with her work. At the moment she produces small hand-woven belts that used to accessorize the traditional clothing of the area. This helps her to generate income for her household. In addition, she engages in farming and raising animals to complement her craft work so that she can earn what she needs to feed her family. Her greatest wish is to improve her income and modernize the equipment for her work.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Edy is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful for being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members have been responsible and supportive. Edy would also like to thank those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will help advance her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in a large amount of wool in varied qualities and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of wool in varied qualities and colors

loans.name: Diana Esther

texts.es: Diana Esther C. es una mejer esforzada de 37 años quien tiene un auto lavado. Este negocio lo inicio en el 2004 para mejorar su casa y sacar a delante a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con el cual piensa aumentarle al negocio y trabajar arduamente para conseguir sus metas que es mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana Esther C. is a hard-working 37 year old woman. She has a car wash. She started this business in 2004 in order to improve her house and get her family ahead. This is her first loan, and she plans on increase her business. She will work arduously to reach her goal, which is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like cleaning products for her car wash

loans.name: Eduvigis

texts.es:
Eduvigis tiene 51 años es madre soltera vive con sus hijos  todos mayor de edad, en la ciudad de Paraguarí.
 
Eduvigis  se dedica a la ventas de ropas y calzados  en forma ambulante cuenta con clientela formada  vende sus sus productos por las compañías de la ciudad como Costa primera, Cerro León, Escobar y Soto, sus actvidades  diarias empiezan a muy tempranas hora de la mañana siendo que la señora se translada en colectivo de un lugar a otro.Tiene una hija que se encuentra trabajando en España, quien mensualmente le gira dinero para ayudarle a su madre.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de mercaderias ya que cuenta con muy buena oferta y de esa forma la Sra. obtendra más ganancias.
texts.en:
Eduvigis is a 51 year old single mother who lives in the city of Paraguarí with her two grown children. She sells clothing and shoes as a traveling vendor.

Eduvigis has an established customer base and sells products made by companies in the cities of Costa Primera, Cerro León, Escobar, and Soto. Her daily activities begin in the early morning hours since she has to move from one place to another. She has a daughter who works in Spain and supports her by sending remittances on a monthly basis.

Eduvigis will use this loan to buy merchandise since she has received a good offer that will help her generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Barbara de 53 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección en su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

La mama le enseño a coser desde que ella era pequeña, cuando creció y se caso continuo con esta actividad para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Hace camisas, conjunto de ropa, pantalones etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos y otras herramientas para su taller de costura y confección. En el futuro quiere tener su taller de costura grande y con gran clientela.
texts.en:
Barbara is 53 years old, and she has a seamstress shop in her house. She lives in an urban area called Guasmo. It is notable that most of the inhabitants in the area are informal merchants. Her mother taught her to sew when she was little. When she grew and got married she continued with this activity in order to be able to help with the family expenses. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. everyday. She makes shirts, outfits, and pants, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tools for her seamstress shop. In the future she wants to have a large seamstress shop and many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 34 años; vive en casa propia, esta casado con Nancy Rodriguez quien es enfermera, ambos se ayudan mutuamente en el ingreso familiar.
Tienen dos hijos menores, uno de 7 quien esta cursando la primaria y otro de 8 meses.
Oscar emprendió su  actividad por iniciativa propia hace mas de 10 anos en el domicilio de su padre, percatandose de la necesidad que habia en la zona de un taller, pues es una zona muy concurrida diariamnente por las personas que van y vienen entre las ciudades de Paraguari y Pirayu.

Actualmente posee clientela formada por la buena calidad de sus  trabajos, ademas tiene anexo de mercaderías indispensable para su trabajo.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como aceites, neumáticos, llantas, corona, piñon, cadena, etc.
texts.en:
Oscar is 34 years old and lives in his own home. He is married to Nancy Rodriguez who works as a nurse. They both support each other with the family income. Oscar and his wife have two young children, one is seven years old and attends elementary school while the other is eight months old.

Oscar took the initiative to start a business more than ten years ago from his father’s house. Realizing the need for a repair shop in the district, he set up his business in one of the busiest areas where people travel back and forth between the cities of Paraguari and Pirayu.

Oscar currently has an established customer base because of the high quality of his work. He also has an inventory of merchandise that is essential for his work. Oscar is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, tires, rims, covers, sprockets, chains, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, tires, rims, covers, sprockets, chains, and other items

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año tiene su tienda, instalada en su misma casa, negocio del cual atiende todos los días y cuando su esposo tiene días libres la ayuda a realizar estas tareas. Siempre esta al tanto de que su tienda esté abastecida con variados productos, que en su mayoría tienen mucha demanda en el mercado y con el suficiente stock puede que posee puede complacer el pedido de sus clientes, además un valor agregado que ha mejorado sus ventas es cuando instaló un teléfono público en su tienda.  Disfruta cada día estar en su negocio, porque esta muy cerca de su familia, además tiene entradas económicas cada día por lo que su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda bien amplia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería y mejorar el servicio de locutorio telefónico.
texts.en:
Elsa is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has been operating a store out of her home for the past year. Elsa attends to her business every day and her husband helps with the duties on his days off from work. She is always mindful of keeping her store stocked with different products, most of which are in great demand in the marketplace. By having adequate stock available, Elsa is able to fulfill her customers’ requests. Something of value that has helped improve her sales was the installation of a phone booth in her store. Elsa enjoys being at her business every day because she gets to be near her family and still have a way of generating an income. Her wish for the future is to have a larger store.

This is her second loan with MFP. Elsa is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. Elsa is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. In addition, she thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and improvements to her phone services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & make improvements to her phone services

loans.name: Por La Gracias De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Por la Gracia a Dios está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Jojana Isabel C. M. vende chiverías, elotes y comida desde hace 7 años. Ella trabaja junto a su hija, mamá y marido los cuales le ayudan. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Mercedes R. vende desde hace cinco años y Yadira Elisabeth Cortes M. quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The “Por la Gracia de Dios” (By the Grace of God) group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Jojana Isabel C. M. is one of them. She has been selling snacks, corn on the cob, and food for seven years. She works with her daughter, her mother, and her husband; they help her. María Mercedes R. is another member of the group. She has been selling for five years. Yadira Elisabeth Cortes M., the other member of the group, sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, meat, corn on the cob, and snacks, etc.

loans.name: Laura Alfonsina

texts.es:
Laura de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando ella era pequeña su familia tenia una tienda. Ella quiso seguir los mismo pasos de ellos y tener su tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo compro algunos víveres y los ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para la tienda quiere el préstamo por eso quiere  comprar  arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Laura, age 49, live in a periurban area called Fortín. It is characterized by its dirt paths and hills. She has a grocery store in the front part of her house. When she was little her family had a store. She wanted to follow in their footsteps and have her own store. Little by little, and with hard work, she bought some groceries and set them up in the front part of her house. She now works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants to expand her business and have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: La señora Judith se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde muy joven, ya que ayuda en la venta a su mama, ahora ella tiene su puesto es en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su esposo trabaja como chofer viven en casa propia en la zona de pacata,  tiene un hijo de 4 años y esta embarazada esperando al otro bebe, el crédito lo necesita para aumentar su capital y agrandar su negocio comprando insumos para ofrecer variedad de refrescos a sus clientes es nueva en la institución, pero la señora es trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Judith has been selling soft drinks since she was very young because she helped her mother sell them. Now she has her own stand on a central street in the city of Cochamba. Her husband works as a driver, and they live in their own house in the Pacata area. She has a four year old child, and she is expecting another baby. She needs the loan to increase her capital and expand her business. She will buy supplies in order to sell a variety of refreshments to her customers. She is new to the institution, but she is a hard-working woman. She is very grateful to the institution for the help offered in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and to buy supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El  Sr. Julio Cesar A.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Noelia Alfonzo Servin con 19 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee dos Automovil Mca. Toyota y Mercedes Benz,  en el cual trabaja como Taxista de Pasajeros en el cruce Tacuara, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la Fundacion Paraguaya y con otras entidades financieras.

             El cliente con este crédito esta pensando cambiar su vehículo por otro mas nuevo para mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Cesar A. is from the neighborhood of Republicano in the city of San Estanislao. He is 29 years old and married to Sra. Noelia Alfonzo Servin, age 19. They have two school age children.

Julio has two automobiles, a Toyota and a Mercedes Benz, that he uses for his job as a taxi driver. He provides passenger transportation services from the Tacuara crossing. Since he has an established customer base, Julio is able to earn a good income. He has good business and personal references and is a hard worker. Julio has been an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya as well as with other financial institutions.

With his loan, Julio is planning to replace his vehicle with a newer one so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 26 años, vive con sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus progenitores. Desde hace 11 años posee una tienda, negocio principal que tiene y del cual se dedica todos los días. Desde entonces atiende todas las mañanas, mientras que su madre la ayuda en la atención hacía los clientes. Su trabajo consiste en administrar su tienda y procurar tener la cantidad de mercadería disponible para abastecerse y realizar los pedidos de nueva mercadería a sus proveedores, de esta manera ha logrado que su tienda se mantenga estable. Por tal motivo desea seguir incrementando su mercadería y tener una tienda más amplia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, menestras y productos enlatados.
texts.en:
Isabel, 26, lives with her children and her mother in her parents' home. For 11 years she has had a store; this is her main business where she works every day. Over this time she has attended to the store every morning, while her mother helps her to serve the customers. Her work consists of managing the store and procuring the merchandise in sufficient quantities to keep the store stocked, ordering new merchandise from her suppliers. In this way, she has managed to keep her business stable. To continue to have a successful business, she wants to increase her merchandise, and have a bigger store. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very content to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be a member of her communal bank because all of the members are cooperative and responsible people. She would like to thank those persons who will originate the loan she is seeking, which will help her to make progress with her business. With the loan she requests, she will invest in groceries such as: rice, sugar, beans and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and canned goods

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El sr. Leonardo F. es de la ciudad de la compañía 2da Linea Ybupora, es casado, tiene 3 hijos. El señor se dedica a hacer flete mediante un camion que posee, inicio su trabajo en una pequeña camionetita ahora ya compro uno mas grande para poder realizar su viaje con mas tranquilidad y para ofrecer un servicios a sus clientes. Posee buenas referencias es una persona responsable honesta y muy trabajdor.
Su objetivo es comprar cubiertas nuevas a su camion para evitar problemas en cada viaje que realiza al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo Fernández is from the city of Compañía 2da Linea Ybupora. He’s married and has three children. He works hauling cargo with a truck he owns. He started working with a small truck but he has now purchased a larger one to do the trips more calmly and to offer better customer service. He has good personal references. He is a responsible, honest, hard working man. His objective is to buy new covers for the truck to avoid problems on the trips he makes to market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tarp covers for the truck

loans.name: Monte De Sion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Monte de Sión está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Bertha del Carmen Gómez V.  quien tiene un pequeño bar desde hace 4 años y desea  tener otro lugar por el oriental.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Carmen V. quien tiene una refresquería y Celina Guadalupe G. quien tiene una pequeña venta y vende fritanga.
texts.en:
The “Monte de Sión” (Mount Zion) group is made up of three hard working women who put forth great effort. Bertha del Carmen Gómez V. is one of the group’s members. She’s had a small pub for the past four years and wants to open another place on the east side of town. The other members are Carmen V., who has a refreshment stand; and Celina Guadalupe G. who has a small fried foods stand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Perla Blanca

texts.es:
La  señora Perla P. D. R., es D. la Ciudad D.  Guayaybi, es casada  tiene casa propia, propietaria D. una despensa en su propio domicilio ademas tiene una peluqueria cuenta con clientela bien formada, con buen ingreso mensual, posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
