 Según ella que empezo con su peluqueria, pero su anhelo era D. tener una despensa., al correr D. los tiempos con el esfuerzo consiguio ahora ya cuenta con su despensa bien surtida., agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la ayuda que le brinda gracias a eso compra mas mercaderias para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes, su sueño es tener un local comercial mas amplia para obtener mas clientes asi aumentar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Perla P. D. R. is from the city of Guayabi. She is married and has her own house. She owns a store that is in her house and she also has a barber shop. She has a well established customer base and good monthly income. She has good personal and commercial references. According to her, she began with her barber shop but her wish was to have a grocery store. In time her efforts led to her being able to get the store and now she has a well-stocked store. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help it provides for it was thanks to it that she bought more merchandise to meet her customers’ needs. Her dream is to have a larger commercial space to attract more customers and increase her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vicenta Isabel

texts.es:
Vicenta de 32 años, , vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas, es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras). 

Decidió aprender a vender cosméticos por la falta de oportunidades y para ayudar con los gastos familiares, ahora ella vende perfumes, cremas, cosméticos por catalogo a sus vecinos y amigos, trabaja desde las  07h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. 

Para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas ella quiere comprar cemento y bloques para mejorar su casa. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener un local de venta de productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 32 years old and lives in a suburban zone called Fortín, known for its dirt roads and slopes. She sells Yambal products (Yambal is a cosmetic company that sells low cost cosmetics for entrepreneurial women). She decided to sell cosmetics because of a lack of other opportunities and so that she could help with the family expenses. Now she does catalog sales of perfumes, creams, and other cosmetics and sells to her friends and neighbors. She works from 7:00AM to 1:00PM every day. In order to give a better life to her daughters, she wants to buy cement and cinder blocks so that she can make some improvements to her home. In the future she wants to make more improvements to her home and open a store where she will sell personal use products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Brenes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brenes está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Ana M. Brenes  quien tiene una tortillería negocio con el que ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo.  

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Virginia M. Brenes  quien tiene una tortillería y María Isabel R. Machado vende helados, choco bananos y cuajada.
texts.en:
The Beres group is comprised of three hardworking and spirited women. One of them is Ana, who has a tortilla making business which has helped her and her three children, of whom two are in her care, to move forward in life. The other members of the group are Virginia, who has a tortilla making business, and María Isabel, who sells, ice cream, chocolate bananas and curd cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Nohemi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nohemi  está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Yahaira Tomasa B. quien vende carne y delantales desde hace tres años. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Felix R. quien vende ropa usada y nueva y comercializa productos Avon mientras Jenny Lorena U. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Nohemi Group is composed of three hard-working and forceful women, one of whom is Yahaira who has sold meat and aprons for three years. The other members of the group are Gloria, who has a tiny bakery and sells Avon products, while Cecilia has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT AND PRODUCING APRONS TO SELL

loans.name: Sinecio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Sinecio L.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio 8 de Diciembre, tiene 67 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Guillermina Wraguez con 62 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos mayores de edad.
 
       Posee un Automovil en el cual trabaja como Taxi de Pasajeros en el centro de la ciudad, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la Fundación.

             El cliente con este crédito esta pensando modificar la chapería de su automóvil y el resto invertir en construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Sinecio L. is from the December 8th neighborhood in the city of San Estanislao. He is 67 years old and married to Sra. Guillermina Wraguez, age 62. They have two adult children.

Sinecio has an automobile out of which he works providing passenger taxi services in the central part of the city. Since he has an established customer base, Sinecio is able to earn a good income and maintain good business and personal references. He is a hard worker and has been excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya.

With this loan, Sinecio plans to pay for cosmetic bodywork to his automobile and invest the remaining amount in construction costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for body work to his car

loans.name: Leyda Edith

texts.es:
Leyda de 28 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura en la sala de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral. Es madre soltera con una hija de 5 años y vive en una casa de caña. 

Empezó cociendo ropa por la necesidad de mantener a su hija poco a poco con la insistencia de la mama pudo comprar unas maquinas de coser y ubicar el taller de confección en la sala de su casa. Su horario de trabajo es de 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Hace blusas, conjuntos de ropa, pantalones.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser y telas. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su negocio y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Leyda, age 28 years, has a workshop of sewing and dressmaking in a room of her house. She lives in a suburb called Perimeter. She is a single mother with a daughter of 5 years and lives in a house made of cane. She began making clothes due to the need to support her daughter. Little by little, with the assistance of her mother she was able buy a sewing machine and arrange the sewing workshop in the room of her house. Her working hours are from 7AM to 7PM. She makes blouses, suits, and pants. With the loan she wants to buy a sewing machine and fabric. In the future she wants to grow her business and to have economic stability for her and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace mas de 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos, por lo que van de botica en botica para proveer algún producto medicinal, Siendo enfermera de profesión, realiza este negocio cuando termina su labor en una posta medica, lo cual hace que éste trabajo sea mucho más fácil, por lo que garantiza los productos que ofrece y recomienda. Esta muy contenta con las actividades que realiza, además que le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para sostener su hogar y para el futuro se proyecta tener una gran distribuidora de productos farmacéuticos en su localidad. Es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos farmacéuticos y de esa manera incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband and child. For the past seven years, she has been selling pharmaceutical products by visiting individual drugstores and providing them with what they need. Maribel is a nurse by profession and started this business when she quit her job in the medical field. She finds that this job is much easier and spends her day promoting the products she offers and making recommendations. Maribel is pleased with what she has accomplished because her business enables her to have the income she needs to support her family. In the future, she hopes to open a large distribution center for pharmaceutical products in her neighborhood.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Maribel is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more pharmaceutical products, which will help increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en: Iasinta F. is 59 and single with six children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Iasinta has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use her earnings (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business. Iasinta joined SPBD in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Iasinta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis M. es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, prendas y su pequeña venta desde hace diez años. Ella con este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores.
M. con el crédito mejorar su negocio surtiéndolos con mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Gladis M. is a hard working woman who has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics, garments and small items for ten years. With this business she has supported her three children, two of whom are young. With this loan, M. would like to improve her business by supplying a greater quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, garments and basic items for resale

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Señor Alcides P. cuenta con 28 años de edad, el nos contó que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la elaboración de ladrillos junto con su tío, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un título universitario. 
Luego, con el correr de los tiempos se hizo dueño de una olería (fábrica de ladrillos a base de arcilla que es quemado en un horno), dicho dinero para la compra de la olería lo consiguió trabajando día a día en la oleria de su tío, compro esa olería para poder de esa forma trabajar  y así construir su propia casa donde más tarde se pueda independizar.
   El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un horno más grande, para la producción de ladrillos de modo que pueda aumentar así los ingresos y de esa forma construir su casa propia.
  El señor Alcides agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcides P. is 28 years old. He says as a young man he began working with his uncle manufacturing bricks. In addition, he never had the opportunity to study and earn a college degree.

As time passed, Alcides later became the owner of a factory where bricks are made from clay and baked in an oven. The money he used to buy the factory enabled him to continue working with his uncle on a daily basis. Through his work making bricks, Alcides was able to build his own house and later become independent.

The loan he is requesting will be used to build a larger oven for producing bricks. This will help him increase his income and complete the construction of his house. Sr. Alicides is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to build a larger oven for baking bricks

loans.name: Fualole

texts.en:
Fualole M. is 30 and married with 1 child (1 year old).  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains). Fualole has 1 year of experience in this business. Fualole needs a loan of 1000 talas to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fualole joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fualole's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis L. es un señor trabajador quien tiene un centro recreativo llamado La Casa del Obrero, donde se realizan bailes al ritmo del chacha, rumba, tango y hasta cumbia.

Es uno de los centros más reconocidos donde las generaciones se reúnen para disfrutar de una hermosa tarde desde los señores mayores hasta los más jóvenes de las familias.

El invertirá el crédito en productos como bebidas, comida etc. para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose Luis L. is an industrious gentleman who has a recreational center called La Casa del Obrero (The House of the Laborer), where he holds dances to the rhythm of the chacha, rumba, tango and even cumbia. It is one of the most well known centers where the generations gather to enjoy a beautiful afternoon from older gentlemen to the youngest in the families. He will invest the loan in products such as beverages, food etc. for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for products such as beverages, food and music for his business.

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana Melva pertenece al Banco Comunal Cielo.
Ana es soltera y tiene una hija de 11 años que estudia; Ana tiene una distribuidora de libros en su casa, sus ventas los realiza en Instituciones y personas quienes le hacen pedido, los libros los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Ana vende productos naturales Biolife y otros productos dependiendo de la demanda.
Ana solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de libros de derecho.
Los sueños de Ana son tener una Distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad y vender todo tipo de libros.
texts.en:
Ana Melva belongs to to Cielo (sky) communal bank. Ana is a single woman and has a daughter of 11 years who is a student. Ana has a bookstore in her house. She sells to institutionas and people to order from her. She acquires the books in Lima. In addition, Ana sells Biolife natural products and other products, depending on the demand. Ana requests a loan of 1000 soles to purchase books on rights. Ana's dreams are to have a Bookstore in the center of the city and to sell all kinds of books.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books on rights for her bookstore.

loans.name: Melquiadesa

texts.es:
Melquiadesa es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio, Melquiadesa tiene un salón de belleza en una galería del centro de la ciudad, su horario de atención es desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, además vende cosméticos por catalogo que también exhibe en su salón.
Melquiadesa es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo y solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes.
Los sueños de Melquíades son construir mas pisos en su casa para alquilar y generar un ingreso.
texts.en:
Melquiadesa is married and has two children who are high school students. Melquiadesa owns a beauty salon in a shopping mall in the city center. Her hours of operation are from 10am to 8pm. She also sells cosmetics by catalogue that she displays in her salon. Melquiadesa is a member of the Cielo Communal Bank and is requesting a loan of $1,100 for the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes. Melquiades dreams of building more floors in her home to rent and of generating revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Nancy es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en local alquilado ubicado cerca del mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor, negocio que inicio hace 1 año y le esta yendo bien, además Nancy junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de agroquímicos en un local alquilado, también Nancy en su tiempo libre vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de panetones. 
Los sueños de Nancy son terminar sus estudios de contabilidad y tener casa propia porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Cielo (sky). Nancy lives with her partner and has two children. She rents a locale for her store near the central market in the city where she sells groceries in bulk and retail, it is a business she started a year ago and it's going good for her. Her and her husband also rent a store where they sell agricultural chemicals and Nancy also sells cosmetics through catalogue on her spare time. Nancy is requesting a loan for 1000 soles to purchase pastries / cakes. Nacy dreams of finishing her schooling in accounting and owning her own home because she currently lives with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase pastries / cakes

loans.name: Yesica Lorena

texts.es:
Yesica es conviviente y tiene 2 hijo que estudian, Yesica vende ropa variada a pedido, tiene clientes a quienes ofrece sus productos, la ropa lo compra en la ciudad de Lima de almacenes grandes, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Yesica vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Yesica es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de polos, casacas.
Los sueños de Yesica son tener una tienda y tener casa propia pues vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Yesica is in a common-law marriage and has two children in school. She sells a variety of clothing upon request and has customers to whom she offers her products. Yesica buys the clothing at large department stores in the city of Lima. Most of her sales are made on credit. In addition, she sells cosmetics through catalogs.

Yesica is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven) and requests a loan of 2000 PEN to buy polo shirts and jackets. She dreams of having a store and owning a home since she lives at the house of her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polo shirts & jackets

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Emiliana, tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos los cuales ha sacado adelante y les ha dado profesión trabajando mucho y con el apoyo D. su esposo.
La Sra. Carmen Emiliana forma parte del grupo "Manos Forjadoras", integrado por 9 personas resientes del distrito D. Comas.
DesD. hace 32 años se dedica a atender su kiosko D. periódicos y revistas ubicado en una zona muy comercial del Centro D. Lima, desD. los 21 años siempre aompañada D. su esposo inició con éste negocio a consecuencia del despido D. trabajo D. su esposo, se vieron en la necesidad D. aprovechar que su esposo aprendió D. muy niño ésta actividad cuando ayudaba a su padre.
Gracias a éste trabajo han logrado pagar los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, construir su casa y sobretodo su satisfacción personal.
Con el préstamo recibido invertirá en la compra D. coleccion D. carros en miniatura que esta promocionando un diario local.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Emiliana is 53 years old, married, and has three children for whom she wants to succeed and proviD. the opportunity to pursue a profession. She works hard and has the support of her husband.

Carmen Emiliana is part of the group “Manos Forjadoras” (Forging Hands), which consists of nine members who live in the district of Comas.

For the past 32 years, Carmen Emiliana has been managing a newspaper and magazine kiosk in a commercial area in cental Lima. Since she was 21 years old, her husband has been helping her with this business since it was started because he was fired from his previous job. She took advantage of her husband’s knowledge of this business since he learned all about it by helping his father when he was a young boy.

Thanks to her work, Carmen has been able to pay for her children’s college education, build a house, and achieve personal satisfaction. The loan she received will be invested in the purchase of miniature cars that are being used to advertise a local newspaper.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miniature cars that are being used to advertise a local newspaper

loans.name: Salmos Group

texts.es:
EL Centro Focal de Collpani, acoge a la asociación “Salmos” desde hace diez ciclos y ahora está con la disposición de iniciar el onceavo ciclo.  
El grupo está compuesto por nueve mujeres y un varón. 

La señora Juana es la presidenta de la asociación.  Actualmente su negocio es la venta de “lencería” (ropa íntima de mujer), ya tiene once ciclo en el negocio.  Para este ciclo está solicitando Bs. 6000.- que le servirá para aumentar su mercadería.
Realiza las ventas en la Feria de Tihuanacu de Lunes a Domingo, de 8:30 a.m. a 7:00 p.m., su venta es ambulante.

En esta asociación encontramos que diversidad de negocios, como por ejemplo: venta de comida, venta de aretes, “Fonda”, venta de golosinas y comida, venta de autoadhesivos, cafetería, venta de frutas y venta de poleras.
texts.en:
Asociación Salmos (Psalms Association) has been meeting in the Collpani Community Center for ten loan cycles, and it is now considering beginning their eleventh cycle. The group is composed of 9 women and 1 man. Juana is the president of the Association. She currently engages in selling lingerie (women’s underwear), and she has already complete a loan cycle with this activity. She is now requesting a loan of 6000 BOB she will use to increase her working capital. She is a street vendor, and she sells her products in the Tihuanacu Fair Mondays to Sundays form 8:30 am to 7 pm. The members of this association engage in different service activities, such as cafeteria and “Fonda” (refreshment stall), and in different retail activities selling various products such as meals, earrings, sweets and meals, self-adhesives products, fruits, and polo neck shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the working capital.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 65 años, es viuda y vive con uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 20 años D. experiencia tejiendo mantos utilizando como herramienta una maquina a base D. madera, que le ayuda a realizar estos telares. Actualmente su trabajo lo realiza en su casa, en compañía D. sus hijas, quienes la apoyan en esta labor. Tiene clientes fijos que siempre le piden los productos que venD., por lo que ha significado un prestigio en su trabajo a la vez que se estabiliza sus ingresos económicos. Adicionalmente a esto también se dedica al cultivo D. maíz y papa, en cada temporada, como es D. costumbre, necesita D. mayor esfuerzo la temporada D. siembra y cosecha, por lo que necesita D. manos para poder acabar con su trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. lana D. diferentes colores y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la siembra D. maíz y habas.
texts.en:
Paulina is 65 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home with one of her children. She has 20 years of experience producing woven garments with the help of a wooden loom. Paulina currently works from home with her daughters who help with the duties. She has established customers who request the products she sells. As a result of the reputation she has earned from her work, Paulina is able to generate a stable income.

In addition, she grows corn and potatoes. Each season, as is custom, Paulina must invest in a great deal of effort to complete the planting and harvesting. For this reason, she must hire laborers to help with the work.

This is her second loan with MFP. Paulina is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of wool in different colors. She will also buy sacks of compost so that she can fertilize her corn and bean crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in different colors & sacks of compost to fertilize her crops

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus hermanas en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar cultivos como camote, frijol y pallar. En esta oportunidad el ha instalado pallar y actualmente trabaja a diario para poder segurarse una buena producción, ya que de estos ingresos depende el sustento de su familia.

Mariano desea asegurarse una buena producción, para lo cual ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir abonos y foliares con los cuales la producción de su parcela quede asegurada.

El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y nos cuenta que gracias al préstamo brindado su cultivo anterior pudo producir del modo esperado. Mariano tiene muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, tanto de la ciudad como del campo, los cuales lo consideran una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mariano is 62 years old, he is single and lives with his sisters in the town of Ferreñafe, located 15 minutes away from the town of Chiclayo. For almost all of his life he has engaged in agriculture: he owns some land where he generally plants crops such as sweet potatoes, beans and lima beans. In this occasion he has sown lima beans and he is currently working daily in order to get a good production, as his family’s livelihood depends on the income of this activity. Mariano wishes to make sure his production will be good, and for this reason he thought it wise to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN: he will use it to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients which will guarantee the productiveness of his land. He has already worked with Kiva, and he says that thanks to the loan he had received his previous crops could grow and produce as expected. Mariano has good references from both his country and his town neighbors, who consider him a very responsible and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and plant nutrients to care for and protect his crops.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.es:
Carmencita es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Carmencita es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Carmencita junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con la cual realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad, su mototaxi lo compro hace una año con dinero que se presto de familiares, ahora ya culmino de pagar y quisiera comprar otra mototaxi.
Carmencita solicita un crédito de 1500 soles que será invertido como parte de pago de otro mototaxi.
Carmencita sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa pues vive en la casa de sus suegros y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Carmencita is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven). She is in a common law marriage and has three children who are in school. Carmencita and her husband own a motorcycle taxi for providing passenger transportation services in the city. They bought this vehicle a year ago using money they borrowed from their relatives. The loan has since been repaid and now they want to buy another motorcycle taxi.

Carmencita is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to use as a partial payment toward another motorcycle taxi. She dreams of buying a plot of land where she can build a house because she current lives at the home of her in-laws. In addition, she hopes to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment toward another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Gloria Maruja

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Gloria es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende lencería, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de1000 soles para la compra de ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Gloria es tener capital propio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero”. She is single and has three children. Gloria has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells lingerie. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and engages in her business every day.

Gloria needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy undergarments. She dreams of having her own capital and opening a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. ropa típica ayacuchana, que manda confeccionar, actividad que realiza todos los días, Eduarda tiene un taller en su casa en donD. confecciona la ropa que también venD. en su puesto.
Eduarda es viuda, tuvo 4 hijos y ahora tiene un nieto a su responsabilidad.
Eduarda es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero y solicita un crédito D. 1500 soles para la compra D. chompas, pantalones y ropa D. bebe.
La meta D. Eduarda es tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Eduarda has a stand at the F. Vivanco Market where she sells traditional clothing from Ayacucho that is maD. to order. She engages in her business every day. Eduarda also has a workshop in her house where she makes clothing to sell at her stand. She is a widow and has four children. Eduarda also has a grandson who is her responsibility.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero” and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN to buy sweaters, trousers, and baby clothes. Eduarda’s goal is to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters, trousers, and baby clothes

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente, Flora es viuda tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella y estudia en la universidad.
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero y solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de pantalones.
Flora sueña con tener capital propio para ya no pedir prestamos.
texts.en:
Flora has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells a variety of clothing. She engages in this business every day. Flora acquires products in the city of Lima where she travels on a monthly basis. She is a widow and has four children, one of whom lives with her and studies at the university.

Flora is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero” and is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN to buy trousers. She dreams of having her own capital so that she no longer has to ask for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers

loans.name: Obaldina

texts.es:
Obaldina es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Obaldina es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Obaldina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, mantas y ropa típica y de las ferias compra cereales que luego comercializa en el mercado Nery, en algunas oportunidades hace papa seca y hace molidos dependiendo de la demanda.
Obaldina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de mandiles.
Obaldina tiene como objetivo mejorar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Obaldina is a member of the Chaska Lucero communal bank. Obaldina is married and has 6 children. She travels to different fairs in the region to sell a variety of garments, like ponchos and traditional clothing. At the fairs, she purchases cereals to later sell at the Nery market. On some occasions, she makes dried, ground potato, depending on the demand. Obaldina needs a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to purchase aprons. Obaldina has as an objective to improve her business and have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase aprons.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 42 años de edad, es separado y vive junto a su hijo en el sector Puente Piedra, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe y se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente ovejas y cabras, el cria a sus animales en una extension de terreno boscoso ubicado cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo suele venderlos a los negociantes y a sus vecinos, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso de la cual depende para mantener a su menor hijo, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura.

Guillermo desea mejorar su negocio de crianza y venta adquiriendo mas animales para engordarlos y venderlos, con esta acción podrá brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 42 years old, he is separated and lives with his son in the Puente Piedra sector, a rural area whose main economic activity is agriculture; it belongs to the Pítipo district and the province of Ferreñafe, and it is located 45 minutes away from the town of Chiclayo. For more than ten years he has been engaging in breeding and selling small animals, particularly sheep and goats. He raises his animals in a wooded expanse of land located close to his home, and when the animals have grown enough he generally sells them to shopkeepers and to his neighbors. This is his main source of income on which he depends to provide for his son, but he also engages in agriculture. Guillermo wants to improve his breeding and selling activity by buying more animals to fatten and sell them, as in this way he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his son. To achieve his goal he thought it wise to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. He is a responsible and hard-working man, whose main desire is to give to his young son the chance to get a college education. He has already worked with Edpyme Alternativa, proving himself to be punctual and responsible with the repayment of his dues.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals to improve his breeding and selling activity.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora María es la tesorera del Banco, responsabilidad que ha llevado muy bien desde que se inicio el Banco, dice que le ha gustado mucho por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la Fundación Espoir.

Tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada hace 28 años y tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales aun viven con ella, su esposo es Ing. agrónomo y se dedica a varios trabajos temporales de su profesión. Estudio belleza en la Academia Romero Bastidas que pertenecía a la Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Tiene un gabinete de belleza desde hace varios años, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de su hija, tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por el buen trabajo que realiza, además vende productos de belleza y de cuidado personal.

Quiere comprar con este crédito un sillón para cortar cabello ya que solo tiene uno y le hace mucha falta otro.
 
Sus sueños son viajar y especializarse como estilista.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscape and for its lovely fresh water spas which are visited by many tourists, the members of the "Nueva Luz" (New Light) Communal Bank meet every fortnight. María is the Bank's treasurer, a responsibility that she has taken on since the Bank began, she says that she really likes the additional benefits that the Espoir Foundation offers. She is 49 years old, and has been married for 28 years and has 4 children, three who still live with her. Her husband is an agricultural expert and has several temporary jobs with his profession. She is studying beauty at the Romero Bastidas Academy which belongs to the Manabí Technical University. She has had a beauty clinic for several years, and she works every day from 8am until 6pm with the help of her daughter. She has a lot of clients who prefer her because of the good work that she does. In addition she sells beauty and personal care products. With this loan she wants to buy a chair for cutting hair as she only has one and she really needs another. Her dreams are to travel and to specialize as a stylist.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a chair for cutting hair.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena es una joven trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, ya que estudia y trabaja, entra a trabajar muy temprano y por las tardes va a la escuela, ella quiere un futuro mejor y con mas oportunidades, desde hace tiempo reside aquí en esta cuidad, pero su familia vive fuera, ella aquí vive sola.  Renta una casa y ella se paga sus estudios y sus gastos, necesita una computadora para hacer sus trabajos de la escuela, es por eso que solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Lorena is young and hardworking, she works and goes to school and really wishes to get ahead. She goes in to work very early and goes to school in the evenings. She wants a better future with more opportunities. She has been living alone in the city for some time now but her family lives away. She rents a house and pays her own expenses as well as her own schooling and needs a computer to do her schoolwork which is why she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora Adelaida tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos que son su vida a pesar de que son mayores se edad para ella siempre serán sus niños, sus hijos estudian razón por la cual se vino a alquilar en la ciudad ya que ella tiene su casa en el campo.

Se dedica ala venta productos por catálogos  productos de Avon, Esica, Yanbal (artículos de belleza y perfumería). Además vende  ropa y  productos naturales,  lo que mas vende es ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, vende bajo  pedido y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar mas mercadería ya que tiene todo entregado y todavía le falta cobrar. Esta en el Banco hace seis ciclos y le encanta por la ayuda que le dan.
 
Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Banco Comunal Nueva Luz (New Light Communal Bank) meet every 15 days in the town of Santa Ana, famous for its beautiful landscapes and its lovely freshwater spas visited by many tourist. Adelaida is 50 years old, she is a single mother of two children who are her whole life, and even if they are now adults they will always be her babies. She owns a house in the country, but she came to town and rented a house because her children are studying. She engages in the sale by catalogue of Avon, Esica and Yanbal products (beauty and perfumes products). She also sells clothes and natural products. What she sells the most is women’s underwear, as this product is mostly requested by her female customers. She sells her products door to door and she works every day for about five hours. She sells by catalog order and cashes in weekly, and she says she loves selling. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products because even if she has delivered everything she still has to cash in. She has been working with the Communal Bank for six cycles and she loves it for the help they give her. She dreams of buying a house in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's underwear, cosmetics and natural products.

loans.name: Angela Celinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora Celinda es la presidenta del Banco Comunal desde que se inicio,  esta muy contenta ya que dice que le han ayudado mucho.
 
Es viuda y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y solo la menor vive con ella en la casa de sus suegros. Es maestra en el colegio Albertina Rivas de la localidad.

Tiene una pequeña granja  de pollos los cuales los compra a un criadero de aves y en algunos laboratorios, los cría y después de tres meses los entrega para la venta en algunas tiendas de la localidad, también vende en su casa en pie o por libras, nos cuenta que también vende pollos de dos a tres semanas al por mayor a comerciantes que le llegan a comprar. Trabaja en su granja tres a cuatro horas en la tarde con la ayuda de una persona a la cual le paga un sueldo.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar mas pollos para el comercio y la cría ya que se viene la Navidad y esa temporada es muy buena.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja con tecnología
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and its lovely sweet water baths, which attract many tourists, the members of the Nueva Luz ("New Light") community bank meet every 15 days. Celinda has been the president of the community bank since its inception; she is happy that it has helped her so much. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are adults. The third lives with her in her in-laws' house. She is a teacher at the local Albertina Rivas school. She has a small chicken yard; she buys her birds from a poultry farmer and some laboratories. She raises them and after three months, she takes them to various stores in the area for sale. She also sells them live or by weight from her home. She tells us that she also sells chickens from three to four weeks old and up to traders who come to buy them from her. She works in her yard for three to four hours each afternoon with a person she has hired to help her. She will use this loan to buy more chickens to raise--Christmas is coming, and it's a good time for her business. Her dream is to have a technologically-equipped poultry yard.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Alejandrina Emperatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Alejandrina  y nos cuenta un poso de su vida, ella tiene 47 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 28 años de la cual ha procreado 8 hijos, su esposo es obrero que trabaja por temporadas.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la localidad, trabaja desde las 4am en la preparación de los alimentos, y cierra su negocio a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos y nos dice que ya son 14 años en su negocio, que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar tres mesas y sillas ya que las que tiene  están desgastadas y deterioradas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 15 ciclos y le gustan las reuniones ya que se divierte con sus amigas.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscapes and fresh water spas which are visited by many tourists.

Here we spoke with Alejandrina and she told us a bit about her life. She is 47 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage for the past 28 years, from which she has had 8 children. Her husband is a seasonal worker.

She has a small eatery in the area market. She works beginning at 4am making the food, and she closes her business at 3pm. She works with the help of her children and she tells us that she has had her business for 14 years. It has always gone well for her, since her customers prefer the flavor that she adds to her dishes.

She will use this loan to purchase three tables and chairs, since the ones that she has are worn out and in poor condition. She has been with the bank for 15 loan cycles and she likes the meeting since she enjoys her time with her friends.

Her goals are to continue moving ahead with her business, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: May Jane

texts.en:
May Jane B., a married woman living in Prk Riverside, Brgy Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Benjie B., 37, works as a teacher, and they have three children ranging in age from one week to eleven years old.

May Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, May Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for her family's future needs and home improvements. May Jane B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

In 2010, Aliitasi joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Aliitasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

With the help of eleven previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Noeta she has been lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She now earns enough money to have significantly improved her family's standard of living. She has applied for a new loan, her 12th, for PHP 15,000 which she will use to expand her business so that she can pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Señorcito Del Cautivo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Señorcito del Cautivo esta formado por un grupo de 9 señoras que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio y buscan la mejor manera de seguir incrementando sus negocios, están seguras que los créditos les van a ayudar a crecer en sus negocios ya que se caracterizan por ser mujeres luchadoras. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad con más importante del Ecuador  por su belleza arquitectónica, sus artesanías, su cultura y su gente.

La Señora. Carmen V. vive por la parroquia de Baños, este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue invitada por una amiga.  Nuestra socia tiene 38 años,   es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 16, 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente en los gastos del hogar, su último hijo  estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Carmen se dedica a la venta de frutas,  realiza esta actividad hace 17 años  en el mercado de la feria libre desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. todos los días, vende todo tipo de frutas y cuenta con un puesto propio. El crédito que recibe lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas como naranjas, sandias, melones, mandarinas, etc. Su meta es realizar el segundo piso de su casa para más comodidad de su familia.

La Señora. Elisa Victoria N. vive por el sector del Crea en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiende 48 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que son mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y su sueldo lo utilizan para sus gastos personales, su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en una fabrica de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Elisa se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de la feria libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, actividad que le realiza hace 22 años, cuenta con un puesto propio, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y vende todo tipo de frutas. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas como piñas, papayas, naranjas etc.  Su sueño es  algún día tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Señorcito del Cautivo (Imprisoned Lord Communal Bank) is composed of 9 women, the majority of whom engage in trade, always looking for the best way to keep on improving their activities. Being determined women, they are sure the loans will help them making their activities grow. They live in different areas of the town of Cuenca, the third most important city in Ecuador for its architectural beauty, its craftsmanship, its culture and its people. Ms. Carmen V. lives in the Baños parish. This is the first loan she is requesting through the Communal Bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She is 38 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 17, 16 and 10. The two older children have a job and economically help facing family expenses, the youngest is a student attending a school in the city; her husband is a laborer. Thanks to hers and her husband’s jobs they have succeed in building themselves a house. Carmen sells fruits every day in the open market from 8 am to 6 pm, and she has been engaging in this activity for 17 years. She sells every variety of fruit and has her own stall. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more fruits such as oranges, watermelons, melons, tangerines and so on. Her goal is to complete the second floor of her house to offer better living conditions to her family. Ms. Elisa Vitoria N. lives in the Crea sector of the town of Cuenca. She is 48 years old, she is married and has 5 adult children: two of them are married and live independently, the other three are single, they have a job and they use their wages for their personal expense. Her husband is a winemaker in a company of the city. They are currently renting as they do not have a house of their own. Elisa sells fruits in the open market of the town of Cuenca, something she has been doing for 22 years. She has her own stall and she works Sunday to Sunday form 7 am to 6 pm, selling every kind of fruit. This is the first loan she is requesting through this institution, and she was invited by a friend to form part of the Communal Bank. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy more fruits such as pineapples, papayas, oranges and so on. Her dream is to have a house of her own one day.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela V., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:

Her husband, Vicente D., is 49 years old and works as a baker. As time permits, he also helps his wife in her business. The couple has seven children who range in age from 7 to 24 years old.  Four of her children are already employed and helping out while the other three are still in school. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of eight previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she is succeeding in lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She is applying for a new loan for PHP 11,000 which she intends to use to increase her income so that she can repair her house.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Flora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family.

With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to buy more stocks and new products for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children and for home repairs. Flora D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa R. is a widow who lives in Prk. Paraiso, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   poultry raising, food vending (bibingka) and a general store.  Adelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelfa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $238, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store and for the maintenance of her piggery and her poultry so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. She also wants to cover fees for her son who wants to work abroad. 

Adelfa R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Sitio. Tagasa, Brgy. Bitoon, Daanbantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $210. Jessica is now borrowing 15,000 PHP to use as additional working capital. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  

Jessica  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Ruphelle

texts.en: Ruphelle R. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Ruphelle is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Ruphelle owns and operates a mini-grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ruphelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruphelle is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery stock in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Aurella

texts.en:
Aurella B. is 54 years old, married and has six children. She is from the village of Bago within the Sindangan municipality, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Aurella makes and sells leather products to local businesses and community members. She has been in business for over 26 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Aurella joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to to purchase materials to make additional leather products. Aurella is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand her product line. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina H., 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Remo H. and the mother to six young, hardworking adults. By the grace of God, Lina has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 Philippine-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 pesos loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lina dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea C., 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Juanito C.. They are blessed in their marriage to have good health and healthy physiques, which enables them to provide for themselves and their families.

Irenea operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands (prepared dishes) costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Irenea hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda P., 52, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Roberto P., a carpenter. Together, they work hard for their family.

Hilda operates a repackaging business. She buys spices like pepper, laurel leaves, garlic and the like in bulk, and then repackages it in little Php1 sachets. These are then sold in the markets and variety stores. Since most Filipino recipes only call for a dash or a sprinkling of spices, these spice sachets are really popular and in demand.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Hilda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Belleza

texts.en:
This is Belleza D., 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Zalde, a driver, and mother to their own little angel. By the grace of God, Belleza has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually send her child all the way through college.

Belleza oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. Tricycles are motorcycles with sidecars, capable of carrying at least five passengers. Due to their compact size, tricycles are favorites when travelling through the small, traffic congested streets of the communities. Income is generated either through direct earning (if the partner or the husband of the partner is the one operating the tricycle) or through payment of boundary (daily quotas, if partner lets other people drive the tricycle and they have to pay a set price, more or less like rent for the tricycle. Any excess beyond the quota will be earnings of the person who rented the tricycle). 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy accessories and spare parts for the tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Belleza dreams of being able to have another business soon, preferably her own variety store. She also dreams that her child will have a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy accessories and spare parts for the tricycle.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla J., 54, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo J., an Overseas Filipino Worker, and mother of two young adults who are currently working and helping out with the family’s finances. At this time, she is working hard to continue provision of their family’s everyday expenses.

Perla maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Perla dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose A., 48, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando A., and mother to four children. By the grace of God, Rose has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to afford to send them all the way through college.

Rose operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at a retail rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Rose dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes G., 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Widowed and left to support her child, Lourdes works hard to be able to do so. By the grace of God, Lourdes has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide for her family. A dream for most Filipino parents like Lourdes, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and sells at retail rates.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php250 in sales every day.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen S., 45, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Nelson S. and mother to a young adult who is already working and helping her with the household finances, and her youngest, who is currently enrolled in college this year. By the grace of God, Belen has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Belen operates a school supplies store where she also sells Fern-C, a Vitamin C supplement. Her customers comprise of students, both elementary and high school, and parents, mostly mothers, who buy her health supplements for their children. She earns to at least Ph200-300 sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like paper, pens, folders, and other school materials to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Belen dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like paper, pens, folders, and other school materials to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace J., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her health care product business for 12 years now.

Grace has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues, because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her health care product business. 

To continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 40,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital for her expanding business by buying additional quantities of health care products, as well as incorporating more varieties of products into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her adopted child’s future.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional quantities of health care products.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 55 years old. Editha is single. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Editha is also a buyer of seafoods. She sells those to the market.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda R. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.
