loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena O. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old. Rowena is married and has 4 school-aged children. She laminates photographs and other documents for a living. It has been her family's source of income for eight years. Out of her income from laminating, she was able to put up sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. Rowena is really thankful for her store because it helps her family a lot. She hopes for her store to grow.

Rowena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for lamination and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house and her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for lamination and additional store inventory.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie L. is a married  who lives in Mantija 2, Mantija, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating an abaca weaving  business. Her husband Avilo L., who is 38 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have a 14 year old child who currently goes to school. Lorelie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009, because she aspired for something better for her family.

With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorelie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family, as well as having enough set aside to invest in other business ventures so that she can continue to improve her family's living condition. Lorelie L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,800.

Zenith is now borrowing PHP 12,000 as additional working capital. This will be her 4th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Zenith aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

texts.en:
Adelita P. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bungtod, Manlayag, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: pig fattening, food vending, and basket weaving businesses. Her husband Liberio P., who is 52 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have 7 children who are 10 to 28 years old. Two of their children have their own family, the other 3 are already working, and 2 of them are currently going to school.

Adelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more feed and vitamins so that she can continue to save up for their future, improve their business and for her children to finish their education.  Adelita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima T. is married to Fidelo T., 52 years old. They have three children who are 15 to 24 years old. The family lives in Bungtod within Manlayag barangay, a part of Danao City, Cebu province in the central Visayas islands. Prima has four businesses: smoking fish, fish vending, food vending and pig fattening.

Prima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time Prima is borrowing 10,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, let her children finish their education and improve her business. Prima is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma C. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying and selling firewood and vending food. She lives in Mariz within Cahumayan barangay, a part of Danao City within Cebu province on the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4700 PHP.

Norma is now borrowing 10,000 PHP so that she can buy firewood and charcoal. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Norma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

texts.en:

>p>
Emilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time Emilia is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and other materials for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future and to improve her family’s living conditions. Emilia A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon G. is a single woman who lives in Sitio. Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Ready-to-Wear Clothes businesses. 

 Maricon joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maricon has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 which she intends to use to buy more stock for her Ready-to-Wear Clothes and General store businesses so that she can continue to save up for future needs. 

Maricon G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF:

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has a mixed farm that produces tea, maize, tomatoes, onions, beans and bananas, which are all sold at the local market. He has been farming for fifteen years in the town of Kisii in western Kenya and employs one farmhand. He also owns and operates a butcher shop in the same location.

Francis is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children who are now between the ages of 7 and 22. All of the children attend school.

Francis recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 80,000KES to expand his butcher shop. The income from this investment will enable him to take his son to college and improve the livelihood of his family. The major challenges he is facing in farming are unpredictable weather conditions and diseases that affect his production. In future, he would like to do large-scale farming and own a string of butcheries to supply meat to institutions.

loans.use: To expand his butcher shop.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and has employed one farmhand. His farm produces arrowroot, yams, sweet potatoes, maize and fruits, which he sells at a local market. He also practices small-scale farming of coffee and tea, which he sells through the coffee factory and the Kenya Tea Development Authority respectively. He also depends on the income from his pension, a home-based museum and a quarry to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan shilings from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into fish farming and poultry farming. He says that these projects will increase his sources of income and will enable him to pay school fees for his children and expand other projects on his farm. He faces the challenges of diseases and a lack of financing and markets for his products. In the future, he plans to expand his fish ponds so that he can be able to harvest fish in tonnes. He further comments that Juhudi is giving financial assistance to the farmers who have been neglected before and that Juhudi staff live up to their promises.

Samson is 61 years old. He is married with four children, ages 22, 19, 16 and 14. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To venture into fish farming and poultry farming

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, a 35-year-old single mother of an eight-year old son, is an active member and secretary of Arithi Group in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years, producing kale and spinach which she sells through middlemen and milk which she sells through the South Imenti Farmers Society in Nkubu town.

Dorothy has requested this loan of 47,250KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the loan will enable her to buy another dairy cow which will increase her milk production and therefore increase her income. The income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of her son. Her biggest challenges have been insufficient animal feed and the high cost of farm inputs, especially fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, she hopes to expand her dairy farming and practice fish farming as well. She says that Juhudi and her membership in the group have helped her to develop a savings habit because group members are required to save money every week.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia B. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling dried fish. Her husband, Artemio B., who is 70 years old, also works as a fisherman. They have five adult children. 

Cornelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cornelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements and home repairs. 

Cornelia B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF. In a world full of challenges Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: M. D. Komla est né en 1983 à KPOKLOLO dans le canton de Gamé (préfecture de zio). Il est marié et a deux (02) enfants. C’est un agriculteur qui n’exerce plus cette activité parce qu’il n’arrive plus à générer suffisamment de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille compte tenu des aléas climatiques. Disposant d’une vieille moto, il changea d’activité et se transforme en conducteur de taxi moto. Malheureusement sa moto actuelle est trop vieille et tombe régulièrement en panne. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle taxi moto qui aujourd’hui est source de revenu très rapide.
texts.en: M. D. Komla est né en 1983 à KPOKLOLO dans le canton de Gamé (préfecture de zio). Il est marié et a deux (02) enfants. C’est un agriculteur qui n’exerce plus cette activité parce qu’il n’arrive plus à générer suffisamment de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille compte tenu des aléas climatiques. Disposant d’une vieille moto, il changea d’activité et se transforme en conducteur de taxi moto. Malheureusement sa moto actuelle est trop vieille et tombe régulièrement en panne. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle taxi moto qui aujourd’hui est source de revenu très rapide.

loans.use: Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Mr S. Komi est né en 1977 à Gapé-Adido dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il vit actuellement à Adam-kondji avec sa famille. Brave cultivateur et grand producteur de charbon de bois, il est surtout exploitant de moulins à maïs dans le Canton de Gapé. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne. Cela va surtout lui permettre de couvrir les besoins de certaines zones et de rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en: Mr S. Komi est né en 1977 à Gapé-Adido dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il vit actuellement à Adam-kondji avec sa famille. Brave cultivateur et grand producteur de charbon de bois, il est surtout exploitant de moulins à maïs dans le Canton de Gapé. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne. Cela va surtout lui permettre de couvrir les besoins de certaines zones et de rentabiliser son activité.

loans.use: acheter et installer un nouveau moulin et réparer d’autres en panne

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Don José tiene 52 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de calzado especialmente para fútbol y a la comercialización de estos productos. El vive con su esposa y un nieto de 5 años y residen en San Miguel. Don José posee casa propia y utiliza una parte de esta para el taller, Él inicio este taller desde hace 24 años y su especialización es fabricar sandalias para niños y en su mayoría zapatos para fútbol.
Don José necesita un préstamo y lo solicita para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de sus productos como cuero, broches, pegamento y otros que son necesarios para la elaboración de zapatos; este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar su producción y sus ventas, porque comprara lo que necesita ofrecer a los clientes diversidad zapatos. 
Sus aspiraciones son poseer un taller grande, tener la preferencia de los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
José is 52 years old. He makes footwear, especially for soccer, and he sells these products. He lives with his wife and 5 year old grandson in San Miguel. José owns his own home and uses part of it for his workshop. He started the workshop 24 years ago and his specialty is making childrens' sandals and soccer shoes. José needs a loan and he is asking for it to buy materials to make his products such as leather, buckles, glue and others that are needed for making shoes. This loan will help him to improve his production and sales, because he will buy what he needs to offer the customers diverse shoes. He aspires to having a larger workshop, having his cutomers' loyalty and improving his income to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 30 años de edad, vive en San Carlos Morazán, junto a su esposo y una hija de 8 años de edad; El patrón de su esposo les ha dado una casa para que la cuiden y trabajen para él, Ella se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa, también cría gallinas para luego venderlas. Aurora solita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de alimento para las gallinas y abono para sembrar una pequeña milpa.
Este préstamo ayudara a que Aurora crie gallinas con la alimentación necesaria para poder venderlas a buen precio, al mismo tiempo podrá cosechar Maíz para el consumo familiar.
Ella sueña con algún día pueda crecer su negocio y contar con los recursos para construir su casa mejorando la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora is 30 years old. She lives in San Carlos Morazán with her husband and 8-year-old daughter. Her husband's boss has given them a house to live in while they work for him. She spends her time washing and ironing clothes, and she also raises hens to sell. Aurora is asking for a loan to buy chicken feed and fertilizer so that she can plant a little corn field. This loan will help Aurora raise her hens so she can feed them and sell them at a good price, as well as allowing her to harvest corn for the family to eat. She hopes one day to expand her business and to have the resources to build a better house and thereby improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed and fertilizer for cultivating corn

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Monsieur K. Joseph est né en 1980 à Gamé dans le Zio. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il vit actuellement à Wonougba où il gère une pharmacie villageoise dans laquelle il vend les produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Son dévouement et surtout la qualité de ses produits lui ont permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qui lui sont très fidèles. Toutefois, il n’arrive pas à faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients faute de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer suffisamment sa pharmacie. Cela lui permettra de faire de bon chiffre et de meilleurs bénéfices.
texts.en: Monsieur K. Joseph est né en 1980 à Gamé dans le Zio. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il vit actuellement à Wonougba où il gère une pharmacie villageoise dans laquelle il vend les produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Son dévouement et surtout la qualité de ses produits lui ont permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients qui lui sont très fidèles. Toutefois, il n’arrive pas à faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients faute de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer suffisamment sa pharmacie. Cela lui permettra de faire de bon chiffre et de meilleurs bénéfices.

loans.use: vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Dadzengo

texts.fr: Orpheline depuis le bas âge, Mme A. Dadzengo est née en 1982. Avec deux (02) enfants à charge, elle vend les produits de premières nécessités et les produits alimentaires à la devanture de sa maison dans la journée et le soir de la bouillie de maïs et de tapioca au bord de la Nationale N°1. Ces activités lui permettent de générer des revenus conséquents. Pour rehausser le niveau de son commerce et lui donner un nouveau souffle, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s’approvisionner en gros en marchandises et produits alimentaires. Le profit provenant de la vente de ses produits lui permettrait d’assurer une éducation de qualité à ses deux filles et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

Le profit provenant de la vente de ses produits lui permettrait d’assurer une éducation de qualité à ses deux filles et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: approvisionner en gros en marchandises et produits alimentaires

loans.name: Akossiwa Françoise

texts.fr: Mme M. Akossiwa Françoise est née en 1957 à Godomé (république du Bénin). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle se débrouille avec le peu de fonds qu’elle a pour préparer et vendre de la nourriture notamment des mets locaux dans son village. Elle a seule en charge toutes les dépenses de la famille et c’est ce petit commerce qui lui permet de s’en sortir un peu. Malgré son dévouement et sa détermination, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfice pouvant améliorer les conditions de vie de son ménage.
texts.en: Mme M. Akossiwa Françoise est née en 1957 à Godomé (république du Bénin). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle se débrouille avec le peu de fonds qu’elle a pour préparer et vendre de la nourriture notamment des mets locaux dans son village. Elle a seule en charge toutes les dépenses de la famille et c’est ce petit commerce qui lui permet de s’en sortir un peu. Malgré son dévouement et sa détermination, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfice pouvant améliorer les conditions de vie de son ménage.

loans.use: acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La señora Claudia y el señor José, son una pareja muy unida, el trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad y ella combina el trabajo con el cuidado de la casa y de los hijos, ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes y piñatas en su casa. Tienen tres hijos que estudian, y en el regreso a clases gastaron mucho en la compra de útiles escolares. Ellos tienen pensado surtir mas mercancía para el negocio y así subir sus ingresos. Y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia and José are a very close couple. He works in a local maquila factory. She combines work with houskeeping and taking care of the children and has a small store for groceries and piñatas at home. They have three children in school and with the start of classes spent a lot buying school supplies. They plan to restock their business with more merchandise so they can increase their income and give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme A. Akou, née en 1971, a vite abandonné les bancs pour manque de soutien matériel et financier. Elle a hérité ce commerce de vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques de sa mère qui est morte très tôt. C’est une femme de bonne moralité avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Ces produits sont très appréciés par sa clientèle et elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures de stocks de marchandises. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter les produits en gros et d’en tirer assez de bénéfice. Le profit permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et ainsi mieux assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme A. Akou, née en 1971, a vite abandonné les bancs pour manque de soutien matériel et financier. Elle a hérité ce commerce de vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques de sa mère qui est morte très tôt. C’est une femme de bonne moralité avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Ces produits sont très appréciés par sa clientèle et elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures de stocks de marchandises. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter les produits en gros et d’en tirer assez de bénéfice. Le profit permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et ainsi mieux assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants.

loans.use: vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques

loans.name: Florence Piyalo

texts.fr: Mme K.  Florence Piyalo est née le 08 janvier 1975 à Kara au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Enseignante, elle s’est adonnée également au commerce de vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames. Cette activité complémentaire marche très bien et elle compte la développer. Elle sollicite donc un crédit afin de constituer un stock important de charbons et d’ignames qui lui permettra de générer de meilleurs bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mme K.  Florence Piyalo est née le 08 janvier 1975 à Kara au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Enseignante, elle s’est adonnée également au commerce de vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames. Cette activité complémentaire marche très bien et elle compte la développer. Elle sollicite donc un crédit afin de constituer un stock important de charbons et d’ignames qui lui permettra de générer de meilleurs bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es: El señor Benito es un hombre con muchas ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, el y su esposa la señora Norma, atienden una tienda de abarrotes que tienen en su casa, tienen dos hijos que están estudiando, el señor Benito es muy trabajadora y quiere lo mejor para su familia, desde hace tiempo ah querido invertir mas en el negocio, comprando mas variedad de productos para elevar sus ganancias. Es por eso que requiere de este crédito.
texts.en:
Benito is a man who is eager to have his family succeed. He and his wife, Norma, have a grocery store in their house. They have two children in school. Benito is a hard worker and wants the best for his family. For some time he has wanted to invest more in the business by buying a greater variety of products so he can increase his profit. To do that, he needs this loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his business.

loans.name: Komi Mawuena

texts.fr: Mr A. Komi Mawuena est un jeune homme né le 24 Mars 1973. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très dynamique, il essaie de joindre les deux bouts grâce à son petit commerce de vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois. Ces produits sont beaucoup appréciés et consommés par les populations. Il sollicite un crédit afin de s’approvisionner suffisamment en produits et satisfaire en grande partie sa clientèle. Les profits générés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr A. Komi Mawuena est un jeune homme né le 24 Mars 1973. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très dynamique, il essaie de joindre les deux bouts grâce à son petit commerce de vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois. Ces produits sont beaucoup appréciés et consommés par les populations. Il sollicite un crédit afin de s’approvisionner suffisamment en produits et satisfaire en grande partie sa clientèle. Les profits générés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
María Asunciona es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de San José, una zona agrícola pertenececiente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Ella cría pavos y gallinas en un ambiente situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. 

Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre cuida mucho de sus aves para que se puedan desarrollar correctamente y sean vendidas a un buen precio. Siguiendo este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la adquisición de alimento balanceado y granos.

María es una persona bastante responsable, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Aternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
María Asunciona is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her family in the district of San José, an agricultural area belonging to Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region, located about two hours from Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For over 10 years she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises turkeys and chickens in an area behind her home. When they reach a good level of development she sells them to her neighbors and to merchants who often visit the area where she lives. This activity is an important source of income for her family so she always takes good care of her birds so that they can develop properly and be sold for a good price. For this, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 new soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of feed and grains. Maria is a very responsible person. She has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual with her repayments. Her neighbors and acquaintances respect her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and grains for her animals in order to expand her business of raising and selling poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr A. Koffi est un jeune homme très entreprenant né en 1979 à Vogan chef lieu de la préfecture de Vo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très entreprenant, il exerce comme activité l’exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches dans le marché de sa localité. Sa clientèle, très nombreuse, est composée essentiellement de femmes et de ménagères. Il n’arrive pas avec le seul moulin à les satisfaire toutes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un nouveau moulin.
texts.en: Mr A. Koffi est un jeune homme très entreprenant né en 1979 à Vogan chef lieu de la préfecture de Vo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très entreprenant, il exerce comme activité l’exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches dans le marché de sa localité. Sa clientèle, très nombreuse, est composée essentiellement de femmes et de ménagères. Il n’arrive pas avec le seul moulin à les satisfaire toutes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un nouveau moulin.

loans.use: exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 51 años D. edad, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. Hot dog, vive con su esposo en el departamento D. San Miguel, Ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace mucho tiempo, su forma D. vender es por medio D. empleados que envía a las zonas aledañas a distribuir los Hot Dog.
Ella solicita un préstamo para el mejoramiento D. su vivienda pues quiere comprar pintura y cambiar la apariencia D. la casa, para ello se necesita contratar personas que se dediquen a pintar y ella no cuenta con los recursos para este proyecto.
Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener las paredes D. su casa en buen estado, que los clientes que le visiten se sientan bien y su vistosidad sea mejor, pues la visitan varias personas y D. esta forma ella tendra su vivienda en mejor estado.
Ana aspira poder sostener el negocio estable por un largo tiempo y mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old. Her business is preparing and selling hot dogs. She lives with her husband in the department of San Miguel. She has been in business for a long time and makes her sales through employees she sends out to surrounding areas to distribute the hot dogs. She is requesting a loan to make home improvements and would like to buy paint so that she can change the appearance of her house. To do this, she needs to hire painters but she does not have resources for this project. This loan will help her to keep the walls of her home in good condition so that it will look better for the customers who visit her; a number of people come by and this way her house will be in better condition. Ana wants to be able to keep her business going for a long time and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint for her house.

loans.name: Koudjovi

texts.fr: Mr Koudjovi J. est né le 31 Décembre 1969 à ASSOUKONDJI dans la préfecture des Lacs. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants et à sa charge sept (07) autres personnes. C’est un agriculteur maraîcher qui cultive principalement des tomates et des oignons. Cette activité très lucratives lui permet de générer suffisamment de revenus pour prendre en charge sa famille et assurer la scolarité des ses enfants. Il n’arrive plus à fournir ses clientes très nombreuses. Ce financement lui permettra de d’étendre sa superficie cultivable et d’acheter des intrants agricoles notamment les engrais et semences. Cela va lui permettre de doubler sa production et de rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en: Mr Koudjovi J. est né le 31 Décembre 1969 à ASSOUKONDJI dans la préfecture des Lacs. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants et à sa charge sept (07) autres personnes. C’est un agriculteur maraîcher qui cultive principalement des tomates et des oignons. Cette activité très lucratives lui permet de générer suffisamment de revenus pour prendre en charge sa famille et assurer la scolarité des ses enfants. Il n’arrive plus à fournir ses clientes très nombreuses. Ce financement lui permettra de d’étendre sa superficie cultivable et d’acheter des intrants agricoles notamment les engrais et semences. Cela va lui permettre de doubler sa production et de rentabiliser son activité.

loans.use: étendre sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles notamment les engrais et semences

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair house roof

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Madame Djatougbé S. est née le 12 Janvier 1950 à Aného, chef lieu de la préfecture des Lacs. Elle est mariée et est mère de quatre (04) enfants dont un autre à charge. Elle vit actuellement à Glidji oû elle gère une boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a une clientèle très nombreuse et exigeante et est souvent confrontée à de rupture de stocks de marchandises dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce financement pour ravitailler sa boutique, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son niveau économique.
texts.en: Madame Djatougbé S. est née le 12 Janvier 1950 à Aného, chef lieu de la préfecture des Lacs. Elle est mariée et est mère de quatre (04) enfants dont un autre à charge. Elle vit actuellement à Glidji oû elle gère une boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a une clientèle très nombreuse et exigeante et est souvent confrontée à de rupture de stocks de marchandises dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce financement pour ravitailler sa boutique, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son niveau économique.

loans.use: ravitailler sa boutique en marchandises

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La señora Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, y su esposo el señor José Ángel  trabaja en una ferretería, la señora Dolores combina el cuidado de los niños con su trabajo ya que la venta de ropa solo la hace los fines de semana. Ellos necesitan de este préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda. Ya que la casa solo cuenta con dos cuartitos muy pequeños y por mayor comodidad para su familia ellos requieren esta construcción.
texts.en:
Dolores is a hard-working woman. She is in the business of selling used clothing. Her husband, José Ángel, works in a hardware store. Dolores only sells clothing on the weekends and spends the remainder of her time caring for her children. They need this loan to build a room in their house. Since the house only has two very small rooms, they need the extra space so that the family may live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Madame T. Kayi est née en 1969 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. C’est une agricultrice maraîcher qui se charge de commercialiser elle-même les produits issus de son jardin. Ses principales cultures sont les légumes notamment les tomates, laitues et oignons. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable. Ce qui lui procurera plus de revenus et lui permettra de changer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame T. Kayi est née en 1969 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. C’est une agricultrice maraîcher qui se charge de commercialiser elle-même les produits issus de son jardin. Ses principales cultures sont les légumes notamment les tomates, laitues et oignons. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable. Ce qui lui procurera plus de revenus et lui permettra de changer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián es una persona muy agradable y responsable, pero sobre todo muy trabajador, el trabaja como despachador en una gasolinera, tiene poco tiempo separado de su esposa, y aunque ah sufrido mucho, le ha echado muchas ganas para  seguir adelante, y también tiene un pequeño estante para limpiar zapatos por los fines de semana. Este seria el segundo crédito con nosotros, en esta ocasión en señor Adrián necesita el dinero para iniciar la contracción de un cuartito, ya que el lugar en donde vive es muy chico.
texts.en:
Adrian is a very pleasant and responsible person but, above all, he is a hard-worker. He works as a gasoline station attendant. He has recently separated from his wife and although he has suffered a great deal, he has a strong desire to carry on. He also has a small shoe shine stand where he works on weekends. This would be his second loan with us. This time, Adrian needs the money to start building a room onto his house because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Etey

texts.fr: Agriculteur maraîcher de profession, Mr M. Etey est né en 1969 à Kpomé dans le Zio. Il est père d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge un autre enfant. Il cultive principalement des légumes notamment les tomates et les oignons. Le financement qu’il sollicite servira à acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa production maraîchère et d’améliorer son niveau de revenus.
texts.en: Agriculteur maraîcher de profession, Mr M. Etey est né en 1969 à Kpomé dans le Zio. Il est père d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge un autre enfant. Il cultive principalement des légumes notamment les tomates et les oignons. Le financement qu’il sollicite servira à acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa production maraîchère et d’améliorer son niveau de revenus.

loans.use: acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable.

loans.name: Ma. Lazara

texts.es: L. señora Ma. Lazara y su esposo el señor Pedro. Son una pareja muy unida y muy trabajadora, por su parte L. señora Ma. Lazara venD. ropa usada los fines D. semana y el señor pedro tiene un taller electrónico. Ellos viven solos ya que todos sus hijos ya son grandes y ya cada quien tiene su propia familia. Ellos necesitan este crédito para invertir más en el negocio D. venta D. ropa, L. señora Ma. Lazara quiere comprar mas variedad D. ropa, pero que en esta ocasión pueda comprar ropa nueva y venderL. para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Ma. Lazara and her husband Pedro are a very united and hard-working couple. Ma. Lazara sells used clothing on the weekends and Pedro owns an electronics shop. They live alone as all of their children are now grown and have families of their own. They need this loan to further invest in the clothing business. Ma. Lazara wishes to buy a wider variety of clothing but this time she will be able to buy new clothing and sell it to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchadise for resale.

loans.name: Hovéamédé

texts.fr: Mr T. Hovéamédé est né en 1980 à Aného. Il est père de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge et vit actuellement à Vodougbé avec sa famille oû il pratique la culture maraîchère. Ces récoltes sont commercialisées par les femmes qui les vendent sur les marchés de la localité. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à fournir toutes ces clientes. Son objectif est de doubler sa production. C’est pourquoi il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra de financer l’achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Mr T. Hovéamédé est né en 1980 à Aného. Il est père de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge et vit actuellement à Vodougbé avec sa famille oû il pratique la culture maraîchère. Ces récoltes sont commercialisées par les femmes qui les vendent sur les marchés de la localité. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à fournir toutes ces clientes. Son objectif est de doubler sa production. C’est pourquoi il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra de financer l’achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable

loans.name: Dalia Marisol

texts.es:
Dalia tiene 29 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos en El Divisadero, Departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace mucho tiempo ya que este es el único ingreso que la familia posee, la ubicación de su pupuseria le permite que varias personas que se conducen por la carretera hacia San Miguel, le compren sus productos.
Dalia esta construyendo su propia casa y aun le falta el techo por lo que solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para techar su vivienda, Este préstamo le ayudara a terminar la construcción y que ella con sus pequeños cuenten con una casa digna, segura y propia.
Su sueño es poder terminar la casa y seguir trabajando para ayudar a que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Dalia is 29 years old and lives with her two children in El Divisadero, the department of Morazán. She has been selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) for a long time and this is her family’s only income. Because of her location on the highway, many people on their way to San Miguel stop at her “pupuseria” (tortilla shop) to buy her products. Dalia is building her own home but it doesn’t have a roof yet. She is requesting a loan since she doesn’t have the finances to put a roof on her home. This loan will help her complete the construction and allow her and her little ones to have a decent, safe, and proper home in which to live. Her dream is to complete the house and continue working in order to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor y  su esposa la señora Isabel, quieren lo mejor para sus hijos y saben que la mejor herencia es una buena educación, es por eso que solicitan este crédito, uno de sus hijos estudia fuera de la ciudad y ellos pagan la colegiatura, pero este año tuvieron todos los gastos escolares de sus otros dos hijos, el señor Héctor trabaja en un hospital de la cuidad, n el taller de ambulancias. Este seria el tercer crédito del señor Héctor, el y su esposa les agradecen su apreciable apoyo.
texts.en:
Héctor and his wife Isabel want the best for their children and know that the best legacy is a good education. This is the reason they are requesting this loan. One of their children is studying outside of the city and they pay the tuition. This year, however, they also had to pay all the school expenses for their other two children. Hector works in the ambulance garage at a hospital in the city. This would be Héctor’s third loan. He and his wife appreciate your kind support.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme D. Adjo est née en 1970 à Goumoukopé dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge trois (03) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement est une opportunité qui lui permettra d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu.
texts.en: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme D. Adjo est née en 1970 à Goumoukopé dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge trois (03) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement est une opportunité qui lui permettra d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu.

loans.use: achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos vive junto a su familia en el sector Sialupe Huamantanga, una zona rural eminentemente agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, conocido por su moderado nivel comercial. Se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica la comercializacion de animales: ella cría, compra y vende todo tipo de animales menores como ovejas, pavos y patos. Usualmente los compra para engordarlos y venderlos en diversas zonas de la región. En este negocio es apoyada por su esposo, quien también ofrece servicio de transporte en una mototaxi. Juntos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia, esforzándose a diario en sus distintas actividades.

Rosa Elvira desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para crianza y venta de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y pueda percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles a sus hijos una buena educacion que les garantice un futuro prometedor. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 28 years old, married and has two children; she lives with her family in Huamantanga Sialupe sector, a rural area of the mainly agricultural district of Lambayeque, known for its moderate commercial development and located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Her business is animale sale; she raises, buys and sells all kinds of small animals like sheep, turkeys and ducks. Usually she buys them to fatten and sell them around the region. This business is supported by her husband, who also provides transportation on a motorcycle taxi. Together they try to take care of their family, struggling day by day with their business activities. Rosa Elvira wants to expand her business and she would like to buy more animals for breeding and sale so that she can increase sales and consequently her income. To achieve this goal, she requested a loan of 1,500 soles by Edpyme Alternativa . She is very devoted to her family and her greatest wish is to give her children a good education that will ensure them a promising future. Among her neighbors and friends she is known as a quiet and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to increase the business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Mr F. Adama est né le 27 Septembre 1967 à Aného. Il est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il entreprit de petites activités génératrices de revenus mais s’adonne finalement à la culture maraîchère, domaine lucratif dans lequel il arrive à s’en sortir. Il sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles. Ce qui lui permettra de donner de bons rendements et de disposer de revenus conséquents pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr F. Adama est né le 27 Septembre 1967 à Aného. Il est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il entreprit de petites activités génératrices de revenus mais s’adonne finalement à la culture maraîchère, domaine lucratif dans lequel il arrive à s’en sortir. Il sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles. Ce qui lui permettra de donner de bons rendements et de disposer de revenus conséquents pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et le bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: agrandir son jardin et aussi acheter des intrants agricoles

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Doña Miriam tiene 63 años y vive con su esposo don Adolfo, en San Francisco Gotera, ella posee una pequeña granja D. pollos desD. hace 15 años donD. ella los comercializa cuando estos ya están grandes, recibiendo los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, el negocio fue iniciativa propia y hoy día es el que cubre las necesidades.
Ella solicita un préstamo pues desea compra más pollos, comprar alimento para ellos, y mejorar el lugar donD. los cuida, esto ayudara a mejorar el gallinero y que los pollos estén mas seguros y con más espacio, también comprara el alimento que necesita para su engorD. y aumentara la granja.
El sueño D. ella es comercializar más y tener una granja granD. que le genere  ganancias y que Dios le conceda salud para seguir trabajando en el negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is 63 years old and lives with her husband Adolfo in San Francisco Gotera. She has run a small chicken farm for the past 15 years and she sells them when they get big enough. She uses her income to cover the household expenses. She started the business through her own initiative and now it helps to cover the basics for her home. She is seeking a loan to buy more chicken, more chicken feed, and to improve the area where she raises them. This will help her to improve her coop and to give the chickens more space. She will also buy more feed to fatten them up and expand her farm. She dreams of growing her farm to improve her income and that God grants her health to keep working in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Madame Ayoko M. est née en 1974 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. C’est une agricultrice maraîchère qui se charge de commercialiser elle-même les récoltes de son jardin. Ses principales cultures sont les légumes notamment les tomates, piments, laitues et oignons. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître sa production et de rehausser son chiffre d’affaires et ses revenus agricoles.

loans.name: Kokovi

texts.fr: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme Kokovi M. est née en 1960 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement constitue une opportunité pour elle d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu et lui permettra de disposer de ressources nécessaires pour s’occuper des besoins de sa famille.

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is married. He owns a small business offering advertisement services. He prints posters for light boxes located downtown along main streets. Petro started this business about two years ago. His income is about 6,000 Grivnas per month.

Petro is a very entrepreneurial person. His goal is to develop his business further. Petro is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a husband and a father of four children from Bethlehem, Tareq works in tourism and transportation, he owns a bus which he uses for organized trips in Bethlehem city- a city which is famous of its religious and tourism attractions in Palestine.

Tareq is an old client of FATEN, he has received many loans to help him in his work and repaid them completely before receiving the last $500 loan which he will use for fixing and applying maintenance on his bus.
Carrying out tours around the city with his bus he is standing next to in the picture here is the only source of income for the family for the last 10 years.

loans.use: Cover maintenance expenses

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie Cañete is a married woman who lives in Prk. 1, Brgy. San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a coffee shop, tricycle transport, and buying scrap. Her husband Romeo, who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver. They have nine children between eight and 30. 

Nemie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy hollow blocks, cement, and piglets so that she can start something new and continue to save up for the education of her children. Nemie Cañete is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad D. A. is a widow  who lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Asia, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, and growing and selling rice. Trinidad joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Trinidad has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more fertilizer for the rice field and inventory for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and improve her standard of living. Trinidad D. A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy D. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by pig fattening, buying and selling rice and farming. She lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000. Percy is borrowing PHP10,000 so that she can purchase more goods to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Percy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Egmedio

texts.en:
Egmedio M. is a 55-year-old married man who supports his family by operating a carinderia/eatery, a general store, and by raising hogs. He lives in Mabinuligon Village, Brgy. San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved his living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of PHP9,000. Egmedio is borrowing  PHP11,000 so that he  can keep his business operations going. This will be his 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of PHP15,000, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Egmedio aspires to elevate his family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena Nuñez is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a business venture; a dress shop  business.  She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. 2, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dress shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP9,000. 

Ma. Elena is now borrowing  PHP15,000 so that she  could  purchase raw materials. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.
